title: Data Analyst
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Business Profile Description
As Singapore’s leading supermarket retail player and a household name close to all, we have grown with you over the years. It is now your turn to grow an exciting new career and fulfil your aspirations with us. Join us as we embark on a journey to make lives better for our customers, community, environment and employees.
At NTUC FairPrice, we offer you more than just a job. We are committed in giving our employees a rewarding career through comprehensive development opportunities. We promise a wonderful workplace culture with ample opportunities for growth at different levels of your career. Every of our 10,000 employees across Singapore is important.
If the prospect of working in an organization at the forefront of retail technology and innovation excites you, look no further.
Grow your career with us today and make a difference.
.
Job Description
The role of Data Analyst will be to apply advanced data analytic tools (statistical modelling, visualisation, and marketing optimization) to solve complex problems, support decision making and design solutions for FairPrice. He/she will report to Head of Business Analytics.
Responsibilities
Analyse business performance and trends to identify potential opportunities for sales growth
This involves deep dive analysis to understand key drivers for sales and developing actionable recommendations for the business
Identifying customer segments and understanding their buying behavior, demographics and life stage to develop strategies on how to engage different customer groups
Measuring the effectiveness of pricing and promotion activities in stores
Developing recommendations on how to use different promotion mechanics
Uncover insights, both descriptive and predictive, for the end-to-end customer management journey, i.e. acquisition, utilisation, retention and reactivation
Develop dashboards to drive the implementation of self-service analytics to the other functions within the organization
Drive transformational change within the organization towards customercentricity and data driven decision making
Qualifications
Degree in Business/ Statistics/ Mathematics/Computer Science with minimum 3-5 years of relevant experience in database marketing, customer dataanalytics or customer data science.
Preferably with working experience in commercial/operational decision making
Must be highly technical with strong data analytics competencies
Focus will be on people with experience dealing with large datasets with heavy transaction platforms
Demonstrated hands-on experience of optimization engines for targeting marketing offers.
Experience in working within data science teams, and product teams utilizing the latest software including capable experience with latest tools like SQL, SAS,R, HADOOP, PYTHON, SPARK, HANA, TABLEAU, and other latest data platforms
Preferably someone have worked on retail and new e-biz enabled models and how data is architected
Able to work independently and manage ambiguity
Clear structural thinking, and strong curiosity for problem solving
Motivated, meticulous and results oriented
Resourceful and problem solver
Excellent interpersonal, communication and project management skills
Team player and ability to collaborate with stakeholders across functions

Data analyst is responsible to gather and scrutinise data using specialist tools to generate information that helps others make decisions, by responding to questions about data and look for trends, patterns and anomalies within it.

Create predictive, prescriptive and/or explanatory models
Generate actionable insights for business improvements

Additional experience in data visualization and/or knowledge of reinforcement learning is a plus

title: Data Engineer - AI Market Prediction
company_info: Technology Service Group Singapore (TSGS) and its subsidiaries have a long history & passion for investing in technology businesses in Asia. Technological progress enables us to contribute to people's happiness and accelerate the benefits of modern life to those who need it most. We aim to build an idealistic society where everyone can enjoy the benefits of civilization, regardless of where they live, by recruiting the best minds in the world.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are an ambitious fintech company using AI to predict market trends and provide our customers with leading-edge trading technology. We are on a mission to make top-tier trading tools accessible to retail investors.

Job Overview:
We are seeking a Data Engineer/Data Analyst to join our team in Singapore. This person will be instrumental in ensuring the quality of data feeding our cutting-edge machine learning models. They will be responsible for cleaning, processing, and organizing vast amounts of data, enabling our predictive models to function at their best.

Key Responsibilities:
Collect, clean, and process raw data from various sources to prepare it for use in our models.
Develop and maintain databases, data systems, and data pipelines to ensure consistent data flow.
Implement data validation processes to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
Collaborate with our data scientists and machine learning engineers to understand their data needs and deliver high-quality datasets.
Identify, design, and implement data process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, etc.
Implement and maintain security measures to keep data safe and confidential.
Required Skills/Experience:
Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Strong experience in data cleaning, preprocessing, and wrangling.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with other programming languages (e.g., Python, R).
Experience working with large data sets and managing data pipelines.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills.

Preferred Skills/Experience:
Experience in financial data analysis or working in a fintech environment.
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and processes.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
Experience with big data tools (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).

Perks and Benefits:
Competitive salary.
Opportunity to work with a dedicated team of experts in AI and finance.
The chance to be part of a rapidly growing fintech company.

title: Data Analyst Intern
company_info: Rapsodo is a sports analytics company that empowers athletes and coaches to analyze and improve their game, with affordable, portable, easy-to-use, data-driven sports technologies. In 2010, our founder and Chief Executive Officer Batuhan Okur registered Rapsodo Pte. Ltd. in Singapore. Our journey began with the development of the first affordable personal golf launch monitor, distributed in the USA under SkyTrak. Since then we have continued to transform into a leading sports data and technology company with the vision to help athletes reach their full potential. Our data-driven, performance measurement tools empower athletes to achieve their best regardless of what skill level they are at.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Rapsodo Inc. is a sports analytics company that uses computer vision and machine learning to help all athletes maximize their performance. Our proprietary technology applications range from helping PGA Tour golfers optimize their launch conditions to allowing MLB pitchers to increase the efficiency of their breaking balls. Current partners include all 30 MLB teams, MLB, USA Baseball, Golf Digest, PGA of America, and over 1000 NCAA athletic departments.
Job Description
As a Data Analyst Intern at Rapsodo, you will contribute to strategic decision-making by dealing and analysing complex data sets, and converting them into actionable insights. This internship is designed to challenge and enhance your business acumen, analytical skills, and leadership abilities, providing you with a solid foundation for a successful career in the sports analytics industry.
Responsibilities:
Undertake data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing, ensuring data quality for insightful analysis.
Employ advanced statistical techniques to distil meaningful insights from complex data sets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to comprehend business issues and devise data-driven solutions.
Prepare and deliver findings and recommendations to stakeholders effectively using visualizations, reports, and dashboards.
Conduct experiments to assess hypotheses, evaluate models, and optimize operations.
Work closely with our software engineers and BIT teams to develop and implement cutting-edge algorithms.
Requirements:
Currently pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Statistics.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Experience in data manipulation, cleaning, and preprocessing techniques.
Knowledge in statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and experiment design.
Familiarity with a broad range of machine learning algorithms, techniques, and libraries.
Experience in creating compelling data visualizations using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to manage large data sets.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
An inquisitive mindset, coupled with a desire for continuous learning and growth.

title: JUNIOR DATA ANALYST
company_info: MOBKOI is a fast-growing mobile company headquartered in London, with offices across central Europe, US and Asia. We use the latest in mobile ad technology to help premium brands effectively reach and engage with their clients' audiences. Bringing to market the most selective site list of premium global and local publishers enabling brands to be selective of where their ads are going to run and thus ensuring brand safety. MOBKOI prides itself on offering full transparency, bespoke creative builds, and local market coordination. We recently joined the world’s first Brand Tech Group, working with partners developing the best technology across the globe.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB DESCRIPTION :

The Analytics team at MOBKOI is in an exciting phase, expanding and modernising our tools and processes as we scale to support the company’s ongoing growth. This is an opportunity to join a talented team at a rare phase, where we have an open brief to learn and work with contemporary technologies to improve the reporting capabilities and application of data within the company.

The Junior Data Analyst (JDA) will support in collecting, processing and analysing the data that MOBKOI receives for ad campaign reporting. Additionally, the JDA will service requests and insight pieces coming from various functional areas such as Sales, Account Management and Publishing.

In addition, we will be evaluating and deploying various modern data tools and platforms (esp. within Google Cloud: Data Studio, Big Query). There will be an opportunity to learn about and develop internal tools using these technologies.

Responsibilities:
Support the Analytics function and projects, mainly in the APAC market with exposure to global projects.
Managing and navigating through dedicated reporting tools for the extraction and transformation of data for various teams within the business.
Developing tools and reports on our internal reporting platform (Currently Google Cloud).
Pro-actively investigating discrepancies and errors in data and reporting errors and looking for optimisation routes.
Responsible for generating media campaign reports and utilising available resources to fulfil data requests from various functions. Support on larger insight pieces to advise business stakeholders on the next steps.
Required Experience:
Strong Numerical, Analytical and time-management skills
Fundamental Data Analysis skills (sound gathering, interpretation and visualisation of data based on creative/KPIs/client needs).
Attention to detail and ‘can do’ attitude.
Competence with modern data analysis tools (SQL, Big Query, Data Studio, and Python, Jupyter Notebooks) and strong willingness to learn
Supporting Excel Knowledge (sumifs, vlookups, pivot tables, index/match)
Excellent communication skills: Ability to clearly communicate insights and recommendations from data, and to gather requirements and feedback from colleagues.
Preferred:
Master's/Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant numerical subject: Mathematics, Engineering, Data Science, Economics, etc.
Understanding of the fundamentals of digital advertising & marketing.
Ability to drive projects from inception to completion.
A demonstrable passion for data analysis & problem solving. Examples of community involvement or other side-projects are a big advantage.
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, Data Studio).
Line Manager:
Business Analytics Manager (APAC) with a dotted line to Director of Analytics (UK)

title: Junior IT Data Analyst
company_info: Established in 1984, Prime Supermarket is one of the pioneer local supermarket chain. Started with 5 mini-mart outlets, we went full format occupying 10,000 sq. ft. in 1991 and grew from strength to strength to become the largest Singapore family owned supermarket chain with 20 outlets across the island.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB PURPOSE
The role of Junior IT Data Analyst is responsible for the provision of executive support in decision making through the sourcing, analysis, review and reporting of information and data.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Execute BI projects within assigned budget and timelines.
Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that are scalable and optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems, particularly from existing ERP systems (MS Dynamics NAV, SAGE300 and their peripheral systems).
Generate BI reports, dashboards and data models with the help of BI tools and MS-Office products.
Filter and ensure data sanity by reviewing digital reports, external data, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Validate data warehouse system for data integrity, quality and accuracy.
Continuous improvement through identifying and defining new process improvement opportunities.
Collaborate with management, internal and external stakeholders as required to prioritize business and information needs by providing technical direction.
Coordinate and facilitate all user training.
Prepare documentation for training, technical requirements, solution design sessions, process workflow definitions in line with existing change control procedures.
Maintain current reporting and facilitate change requests as needed.
Ensure the timely and effective delivery of planned solutions into ongoing daily activities.
Analyse and compile data and BI reports issues for reporting.
Troubleshoot and coordinate with third party consultants as needed to resolve issues.
Remain current on industry trends with respect to BI capabilities.
Ability to be available for other duties as and when assigned.
Job Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in IT/CS/Mathematics or equivalent, with 2-3 years’ of relevant work experience in the retail industry or similar.
Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
Microsoft business applications such as Office 365, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Technical expertise in designing, building and implementing data visualization packages in different formats.
Strong knowledge of and experience with Python, reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks).
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc).
Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem skills.
Ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
Experience in the following are added advantages:
JET Reports Enterprise
ERP Solutions (MS Dynamics NAV/SAGE300)
Retail Management
Warehouse and/or Supply Chain Management
Excellent written and oral communication.
Ability to work independently with little direction in a fast-paced environment.
Demonstrated skills utilizing project management tools and methodologies.
Ability to meet stated deadlines, while managing multiple projects and activities.
Possess good interpersonal skills.
Engage others in a positive manner.
Possess strong attention to detail.
Possess strong verbal and communication skills.
Be willing to raise issues and concerns promptly.

description:

Job Responsibilities;
Manage a team of data scientists and data analysts
Work closely with business users of the group to build a strong pipeline of impactful projects. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, and SQL, along with experience working with large-scale big-data processing frameworks
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts clearly and effectively
Strong team management skills who can motivate and grow the team and has strong organization skills. Effective in setting and managing individual and team KPIs and goals

Vanderlande’s baggage handling systems move 3.7 billion pieces of luggage around the world per year. Established in 1949, Vanderlande has more than 5,000 employees, and a consistently increasing turnover of more than 1.1 billion euros. Changi Airport Group (CAG) has selected Vanderlande as the baggage handling supplier for the Terminal 1 Redevelopment project at Singapore Changi Airport, and we are, therefore, looking for new team members! description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Database Analyst
Job Description:
Are you our upcoming technical service expert? Do you like to take an extra step, analyzing the performance of a logistical system?
Vanderlande understands the complexities associated with a successful airport and parcel operation and delivers future proof logistic process automation. These automation systems are composed of many (electro-) mechanical, IT and controls components that require expert knowledge to support and improve.
You are responsible of making sure the performance evaluation and improvement of the system is made as determined in the service contract. You will be detecting the possible bottlenecks before causing delays and increasing the efficiency of the system, decreasing down time, and maximizing flow.
Your tasks and responsibilities
As Database Analyst, you are responsible for analyzing the performance of the material handling system, making regular reports with usable insight, communicating the outcome with internal/external stakeholders, and evaluating the results to improve the system and process.
You will perform root cause analysis in case of operational issues and coordinate the changes/ lead the problem management.
You will develop and create Splunk-based dashboards, using the data sets, templates, and standardization in order to provide insight into and increase the performance of the system.
You will evaluate data of performance indicators and help selling improvement possibilities to the customer.
You initiate and implement revisions, modifications and retrofits (RMR).
As Data Analyst you report to the Maintenance Manager. Based on your field of interest there is opportunity to grow to a specialized or manager role within the service or project execution department.
Your department:
The Changi Operation and Maintenance Team is part of the APAC Lifecycle Services (LCS) in the Business unit Airport & Parcel Solutions (APS) within Vanderlande Industries. The primary task is to support Changi T1.
The department works in an international team setting with people from different countries with different cultural backgrounds.
Your Profile:
You are an analyst who can easily bridge between the physical and software world. You have a systematic way of troubleshooting. You like to work together in an international multi-disciplinary team of engineers.
You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or logistics.
Preferably you have good understanding of IT service management practices (ITIL v3/v4) as well as Lean and Six Sigma
Affinity with IT and Industrial Automation and interested in logistic processes.
2-5 years of relevant working experience is preferred
Hands-on experience with SQL querying and Splunk SPL is preferred.
You are an advanced level user with Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word and PowerPoint
You know how to use regular expressions.
Knowledge of testing methodologies and troubleshooting techniques
You have excellent communication skills, writing and speaking in English language.
Assertive team player and proactive
You are customer oriented, proactive and have a drive for continuous improvement

Will be responsible for mapping and transforming data from source systems to target systems, ensuring accurate and consistent data migration and integration.

Experience in analysing complex data sources and systems, understanding data relationships, and mapping data across different platforms and formats.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Role: Data Lost Prevention Analyst
(Key skills: Analysing, and investigating of insider threats and data leakage incidents)

Job level: Preferably 3 to 5 years of related experience (L2)
Job description
Key Skills:
Analysing, and investigating of insider threats and data leakage incidents
Job Objectives
Data Lost Prevention Analyst is an operational role within Bank’s Group Security Operations Center.
The incumbent will be responsible for the continuous monitoring, analyzing, and investigating of insider threats and data leakage incidents. He/She must have good analytical and investigative skills to recognize and detect anomalous behavior.
Key Responsibilities
To participate in the day-to-day monitoring, triaging, and investigating of potential suspected anomalous usage behavior alerts
To work with internal teams to validate alerts within stipulated SLA
To perform analysis on usage behavior trends to discover potentially fraudulent activities
To perform continuous review and improvement on current monitoring operations to enhance effectiveness of monitoring
Work with external partners to resolve issues or implement improvement to monitoring
To gain good understanding of internal business applications to be able to analyze, recognize and identify potentially anomalous activities
Investigate Data Loss Prevention (DLP) alerts and escalate DLP incidents in accordance to the DLP incident response and handling procedures
Carry out DLP System Ruleset change requests in accordance to change management procedures
Support management reporting of DLP incidents and statistics for ad-hoc and monthly reporting
Coordinate DLP audit requests; respond to questions or reporting requirements from local authorities as required
To work with internal cyber security teams to ensure investigations are comprehensive and to track and follow up on all escalated incidents to closure.
Key Requirements
Education
Diploma/Degree in Business Information Technology/Business Analytics from recognized academic institutions
Technical Skills and Experience
Minimum 3-5 years of relevant experience as an insider fraud/threat analyst in a financial institution
Excellent analytical and investigative skills
Prior experience with analytical platforms
Experienced with working with machine learning enabled platforms would be advantageous
Experience with administration and operation of DLP Systems preferred
Experience in development and fine tuning of DLP Ruleset preferred
Knowledge of Cyber Security would be advantageous
Relevant working experience in SOC environment and related processes will be added advantages
Soft Skills
Good communication skills

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
He/She will be part of the Research Department to help undertake research and analysis on issues that are relevant to the institution using data science techniques. He/She will help to interpret and manage data and solve complex problems using expertise in a variety of data niches. He/She will also work with multidisciplinary teams/stakeholders (e.g. clinicians, pharmacists, managers) to determine how to use business data for valuable healthcare solutions.
He/She will also be involved in developing relevant visualizations dashboards for monitoring purposes as well as creating custom-made data models and algorithms and leverage on them to improve patient experiences, revenue generation and monitor results of interventions.
He/She will also conduct literature review on specific research projects, be involved in scientific writing and/or generate technical reports. This will keep him/her abreast with the latest innovations in data science.

Requirements:
Foundation in computer science, modeling, statistics, analytics & mathematics, coupled with a strong business sense
Knowledge of machine learning techniques, including decision tree learning, clustering, artificial neural networks; experience with statistical programming languages (e.g. Python, R, SQL) to process data and gain insights from it
Multilingual coding knowledge/experience Java, JavaScript, C, C++ (preferred)
Experience/knowledge in data-mining techniques (e.g. social network analysis, natural language processing, time series analysis)
Candidate also need to be a team player and have a problem-solving aptitude
Ability to write reports, grant proposals and scientific papers. Track record of scientific publications is advantageous
Coordinate with research partners during project implementation

Responsibilities:

Data Modeling: designing and implementing data modeling solutions to ensure that the data is properly structured and organized for analysis.
Data Analysis, Reporting and Dashboarding: responsible for analyzing, and interpreting data to support decision-making. Utilize data analytics techniques to identify trends, track KPIs, and provide insights that drive business objectives.

Proficient in cloud data warehousing technologies (Azure environment), including Microsoft BI technology (SSRS, SSIS, SSAS and Power BI) • experience in ETL, SQL, and data modeling techniques.
Strong in programming languages such as SQL, Python, or R.
Strong analytical skills to identify patterns and insights from large and complex data sets.

Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
You will be reporting to the Head of IT, this role is key to driving forward data change in the organisation, making data accessible and visible and working closely with business stakeholders in order to enable data driven decisions at the senior level. You are not just doing data reporting but would be required to build a Data Warehouse in a Greenfield environment. You will work with the Head of IT to drive data strategy and liaise closely with key business stakeholders to deliver data projects. Your role will focus on analysing, modelling, building and connecting data to support and drive continued visualisation and analytics across the business. It will include the production of analytical dashboards, supporting the major fleet IT data projects and supporting the build and connectivity of data platforms. This role requires a strong business focus with the ability to deliver continuous value. This is a senior individual contributor position where you will start and build concept analysis, place together Architecture and eventually expand into your own team.
This role comes with budget responsibilities and a data analyst.
This is an exciting opportunity to be part of driving forward the digitalisation strategy which includes cloud, fleet and data transformation programs.
Job Accountabilities/Key Responsibilities:
Work with the Head of IT to continue to drive data strategy and build data awareness.
Partner with key business stakeholders to deliver reporting and dashboard solutions.
Drive the build and delivery of a data warehouse and/or a data lake platform
Utilize BI and analytical tools to visualize data effectively and analyze and present results in a clear and concise manner.
Work with the technical team to contribute to the delivery of Fleet IT data projects
Define and identify gaps between current challenges and future business needs.
Deliver data analytics and predictive models where appropriate.
Partner with the commercial operations team to support and drive improvements in their commercial platform and reporting outcomes.
The ideal candidate is pro-active, conceptual and a self-starter. You will be able to manage multiple stakeholders including vendors, internal system owner, senior stakeholders, head of business and end users. You will be able to advise direction and drive improvements forward as well as manage existing expectations. You should be able to visualize the end-to-end business process clearly in mind based on users’ requirement so as to present a feasible solution. You possess a positive working attitude and have proven ability working in a fast-paced and dynamic working environment.
Qualifications & Experience:
BSc in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
Over 10 years practical experience in data design, build and visualization.
Proven working experience as a Data Architect
Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
Proven experience working closely with business stakeholders to gather data requirements and deliver outcomes.
You will have a broad background and depth in data for a number of years.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design and development, data warehouse design, data lakes, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Experience building a data warehouse (MANDATE)
Knowledge of modern data architecture using data lakes would be an advantage.
Good and deep understanding of design, kick off and data modeling skills (MANDATE).
Proven experience in producing visualisations and dashboards for business stakeholders.
Strong knowledge of and experience with PowerBI and other visualization tools such as Qliksense, Tableau, Cognos, etc.; databases (MSSQL, Oracle etc); programming (SQL, Python, Java, R, JSON)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Knowledge of commercial shipping systems such as IMOS would be an advantage.
In-house data warehouse and data experiences are preferred.
Desired Skills & Competencies:
Leading & Deciding
Takes control and exercises leadership
Initiates action, gives direction and takes responsibility
Interacting & Presenting
Communicates and networks effectively
Successfully persuade and influences others
Relates to others in a confident and relaxed manner
Analysing & Interpreting
Shows evidence of clear analytical thinking
Gets to the heart of complex problems and issues
Applies own expertise effectively
Quickly learns new technology
Communicates well in writing
Creating & Conceptualising
Open to new ideas and experiences
Seeks out learning opportunities
Handles situations and problems with innovation and creativity
Thinks broadly and strategically
Supports and drives organisational change
Organising & Executing
Plans ahead and works in a sytematic and organised way
Follows directions and procedures
Focuses on customer satisfaction and delivers quality service to the agreed standards
Desired Values:
Integrity
Responsibility
Customer Focus
Quality
Responsiveness
Innovation
Teamwork

Senior managers and executives across the business

Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's capital position, as well as "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings, is among the highest in Asia-Pacific. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Business Function
Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the “World’s Best Bank” (Euromoney 2018, 2019 and 2020). Our approach is a combination of both science and art. We immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our innovation pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play. We are passionate and committed to making banking joyful (while having lots of fun)!
The Institutional Banking Group’s (IBG) Data Chapter team is committed to building a data driven organization and maximizing the key data capabilities to transform how IBG does business. Data impacts IBG’s business every day, and a culture of relentlessly using data and business intelligence will enable IBG to achieve exponential growth
Responsibilities
(1) Dashboard Development
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their reporting needs within the Cash and Digital Products domain.
Design and develop interactive and visually appealing data dashboards and reports using tools such as QlikView or Qlik Sense.
Ensure the accuracy, timeliness, and reliability of data presented in the dashboards.
Continuously improve and optimize existing dashboards to provide more insightful information to stakeholders.
(2) Project Management
Lead data analysis projects from initiation to completion, ensuring they are aligned with Business objectives.
Define project scope, objectives, and deliverables, and develop project plans and timelines.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams, data engineers, and other relevant stakeholders to gather data and insights required for projects.
Monitor project progress, identify potential issues, and implement corrective actions to ensure projects are completed on time and within scope.
Present project updates and findings to senior management and stakeholders
(3) Stakeholder Management
Act as the primary point of contact for business stakeholders within the Open Account Trade Products domain.
Conduct regular meetings with stakeholders to understand their evolving data needs and priorities.
Translate business questions into actionable data analysis and provide insights and recommendations that support decision-making.
Foster strong relationships with stakeholders by effectively communicating findings and ensuring their data requirements are met.
(4) Mentorship
Provide guidance and mentorship to junior team members, helping them improve technical expertise and acquire Open Account Trade Products domain knowledge.
Promote a culture of data-driven decision-making by setting technical standards, sharing best practices and encouraging knowledge sharing within the team.
(5) Data Transformation
Utilize data programming languages, including Python and SQL, to access, clean, transform, and manipulate data from various sources.
Ensure data quality and integrity by implementing data validation and cleansing processes.
Collaborate with data engineering teams to streamline data pipelines and automate data extraction and transformation tasks.
(6) Data Storytelling
Create clear and compelling data narratives using Excel and PowerPoint to convey data insights and trends.
Tailor data presentations to the audience, whether technical or non-technical, ensuring effective communication of complex information.
Collaborate with stakeholders to develop actionable recommendations based on data-driven insights.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in a related field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Finance) is preferred.
Minimum of 7 years of experience in data analysis and business intelligence, ideally with a focus on the Cash and Digital Products domain.
Proficiency in data programming languages, including Python and SQL, for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Strong experience with data visualization tools such as QlikView or QlikSense.
Advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint for data presentation and storytelling.
Proven project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and analytically.
A ‘can-do’ attitude with a strong commitment to achieve results and driving data-driven decision-making.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas in a clear and concise manner.
A pleasant personality and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Experience: 3-5 Years
Role: Data Lost Prevention Analyst

Key Skills:
Analysing, and investigating of insider threats and data leakage incidents
Key Responsibilities:
· To participate in the day-to-day monitoring, triaging, and investigating of potential suspected anomalous usage behavior alerts
· To work with internal teams to validate alerts within stipulated SLA
· To perform analysis on usage behavior trends to discover potentially fraudulent activities
· To perform continuous review and improvement on current monitoring operations to enhance effectiveness of monitoring
· Work with external partners to resolve issues or implement improvement to monitoring
· To gain good understanding of internal business applications to be able to analyze, recognize and identify potentially anomalous activities
· Investigate Data Loss Prevention (DLP) alerts and escalate DLP incidents in accordance to the DLP incident response and handling procedures
· Carry out DLP System Ruleset change requests in accordance to change management procedures
· Support management reporting of DLP incidents and statistics for ad-hoc and monthly reporting
· Coordinate DLP audit requests; respond to questions or reporting requirements from local authorities as required
· To work with internal cyber security teams to ensure investigations are comprehensive and to track and follow up on all escalated incidents to closure
Key Requirements:
Education
· Diploma/Degree in Business Information Technology/Business Analytics from recognized academic institutions
Technical Skills and Experience
· Minimum 3-5 years of relevant experience as an insider fraud/threat analyst in a financial institution
· Excellent analytical and investigative skills
· Prior experience with analytical platforms
· Experienced with working with machine learning enabled platforms would be advantageous
· Experience with administration and operation of DLP Systems preferred
· Experience in development and fine tuning of DLP Ruleset preferred
· Knowledge of Cyber Security would be advantageous
· Relevant working experience in SOC environment and related processes will be added advantages
Soft Skills
· Good communication skills

title: Data Analyst (Ref:DMOIT)
company: NATIONAL CANCER CENTRE OF SINGAPORE PTE LTD
company_info: NATIONAL CANCER CENTRE OF SINGAPORE PTE LTD
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The National Cancer Centre Singapore (NCCS) is a leading national and regional tertiary cancer centre, attending to the majority of cancer cases in Singapore’s public healthcare sector. NCCS offers world class oncology care by having the best talent, doing robust clinical and translational research and leading education efforts to improve cancer outcomes. You will be actively involved in data management of clinical research studies and long-term study databases for NCCS. We currently have the following opening and would like to invite you to be part of an ongoing and dynamic team.

Your responsibilities will include:

1. Extract data from medical case report, maintain database, and perform data mining from hospital electronic medical record (EMR).
2. Perform ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) raw data from enterprise data warehouse.
3. Harmonize data from multiple sources and transform raw data into analyzable insights.
4. Perform analysis of registries and databases to identify and interpret key patterns and to support the communication of these insights to internal and external stakeholders on a planned regular basis and on ad hoc requests.
5. Database environment scheduled server maintenance and acceptance tests.
6. Cross-institutional access account application and management.
7. Maintain and build AI applications across tumor types, for examples, information extraction, entity recognition and predictive analysis with machine learning models.

Requirements:
- Degree in Life Sciences, Health Sciences, Bioinformatics, Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Science and/or Business Analytics.
- Must have programming and data science background, including data wrangling skills using Python and technical knowledge on SQL
- Skill and knowledge on other tools like R, programming, OBIEE, JSON, XML, HTML, structured and unstructured data processing and Tableau will have an added advantage.
- Experience in healthcare data and health data standards is desirable.
- Experience in descriptive and predictive analytics will be preferred.
- Meticulous, with excellent organizational and time management skills.
- Good communication, organisational and interpersonal skills.
- Ability to complete tasks independently with minimal supervision.
- Ability to work on multiple projects involving multiple stakeholders concurrently.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our Client a supply chain operator is in the midst of expanding their IT Team. This is a great opportunity to join a growing data science team IT. You will be a part of a diverse and global team that is leading the way in developing cargo solutions that make supply chains more agile, resilient, and sustainable.

Role
Data Extraction and Analysis: extract and analyse large volumes of data from various sources. He or she will gather relevant data for audit testing, identifying patterns, anomalies, and trends, and performing data-driven analysis to assess control effectiveness, detect fraud, or identify areas of risk.
Data Visualisation: create visually appealing and insightful dashboards, charts, and graphs to present audit findings and communicate complex data in a more understandable and impactful manner.
Data Analytics Tools and Techniques: use data analytics tools and techniques such as statistical analysis, regression modelling, data mining, and predictive analytics to assist internal auditors in identifying key risk indicators, conducting trend analysis, and predicting potential risks or control weaknesses.
Automation and Continuous Monitoring: automate repetitive audit tasks, such as data extraction, data cleansing, and report generation, by leveraging data analytics software or programming languages. This is to allow auditors to focus more on higher-value activities and perform continuous monitoring of key controls and indicators.
Fraud Detection and Prevention: to assist internal auditors in developing and implementing data-driven fraud detection and prevention techniques. He /she will analyze transactional data, identify suspicious patterns or outliers, and collaborate with auditors to design and implement controls that mitigate fraud risks effectively. Investigations assignments may also be conducted when required or on requests of management.
Data Governance and Data Quality: contribute to the establishment of robust data governance frameworks and data quality assurance processes and work closely with IT teams to ensure data integrity, accuracy, and availability, which is crucial for reliable audit testing and analysis.

Requirements

Education
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Management, Engineering, or a related field.
Skillsets and Experience
At least 4years of relevant working experience in data analytics, process improvement, and digital transformation.
Experience using data analytics tools and techniques to extract, analyze, and visualize large volumes of data.
Experience using robotics and intelligence tools to automate repetitive tasks and improve work processes.
Experience using business intelligence tools to create dashboards and reports that communicate data insights.
Knowledge of software (Galvanize Highbond) and analytics tools (ACL, Oracle Transaction Business Intelligence OTBI) is an advantage.
Prior experience working in Internal audit deparment would be an advantage.
APPLY NOW! Interviews are ongoing! Email to dayna.chiam@stellar-link.com
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates would be notified.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary
We are looking for a skilled and motivated Data Analyst for a global mining company. In the capacity of a Data Analyst, your primary duties will involve the examination of data, overseeing data catalogs, and scrutinizing the flow of data into Microsoft Purview. This position presents an exceptional chance for you to make meaningful contributions to a range of initiatives, such as SAP version upgrades. Additionally, you will be actively engaged in spotting possibilities to enhance application efficiency, eliminate duplications, and enhance the efficiency of business procedures.

Key Responsibilities
Employ your data analysis proficiency to scrutinize, decipher, and extract valuable insights from intricate datasets.
Offer data-backed suggestions to bolster decision-making procedures.
Uphold and augment data catalogs accessible through different interfaces, ensuring comprehensive data accessibility.
Guarantee the uniformity, precision, and availability of data for pertinent stakeholders.
Investigate and attain an in-depth understanding of the mechanisms for data migration into Microsoft Purview.
Detect potential enhancements and efficiencies in data handling procedures for improved productivity.
Actively pinpoint chances to simplify applications, eliminate duplications, and optimize business workflows.
.
Key Qualifications
Minimum of 5 years of data analyst experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R) and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Proficiency in managing data catalogs across multiple interfaces.
Experience in ensuring data quality and accessibility is a plus.
Familiarity with Microsoft Purview or similar data management platforms is desirable.
The ability to quickly onboard and navigate a complex work environment.
High level of attention to detail to ensure data accuracy and quality.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to convey complex data findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams and adapt to changing project requirements.
A proactive and creative problem solver who can independently identify and address data-related issues.
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified / contacted.

title: Business Data Analyst
company: SONY ELECTRONICS ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
company_info: SONY ELECTRONICS ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Business Data Analyst, you will be responsible for the analysis of the Service financial data in our customer service solutions group. You will also be working closely with other relevant teams/stakeholders to support the forecasting/budgeting activitiesand investigating discrepancies in financial results or trends.

What you will be doing
· Analysis of financial data and preparing monthly financial report (relatable to service costs) – extracting and defining relevant information
· Support and co-ordinate with various stakeholders to prepare data/report for service repair cost forecasting/budgeting activities on a timely basis
· Make use of data analytics tools to revamp the current process to meet accuracy
· Review current service repair cost forecast logic/process and make improvement suggestions
· Engage relevant stakeholders for variance analysis including identifying gaps, reviewing and investigating irregular financial results or trends
· Participate/support projects under strict timelines
· Perform other duties as assigned.

What you should have
· Bachelor’s degree in Business/Statistics/Mathematics/Accounting/Finance/Computing or any related field
· 2-5 years’ work experience with statistical analysis and trend forecasting, preferably in customer service field
· Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools, especially Microsoft Excel

What will help you succeed
· Knowledge/experience in Microsoft Excel macros and coding, Forecasting/ Planning tool, Anaplan skill is preferred
· Analytical mindset and strong business acumen.
· Possess a demonstrated sense of urgency with the ability to perform well under pressure
· Able to create and present good presentation content for peers and management
· Possess good communication and influencing skills interacting with different stakeholders
· Pro-active team player who is able to perform tasks that requires meticulous attention to detail

Benefits you will have
· Flexible work arrangement (because we understand Life happens)
· Comprehensive medical benefits (including physical health screenings and term life insurance benefits)
· AWS and variable bonus
· Special staff purchase rates
· Flexible benefits (so you can claim for that staycay or gym membership you’ve been eyeing)
· Corporate social responsibility time off for 1 day each year to volunteer for a charity of your choice
· Milestone gifts (such as long service award and marriage gift because we want to celebrate both your professional and personal milestones)
· Wellness activities to promote healthy lifestyles
· Curated training programmes to encourage continuous professional development

At Sony, we strive to create a place for you to realise your potential and inspire you to make positive impact through innovation, smart collaboration and boundless curiosity. We are looking for people who believe that they can enrich lives and help us achieve our purpose – fill the world with emotion, through the power of creativity and technology.

Experience in data analysis (e.g. understanding of data representation in systems, design data transformation logic, investigate data issues) through direct query of databases.
Ms
Possess strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.

Experience in the documentation of BRD, FSD, use cases, and business processes.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Excellent team player and placing team objectives above self.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
about the company
Long standing history and strong global operations, this company has been growing aggressively organically and through acquisitions. Constantly innovating to meet the changing consumer needs and behaviours while expanding their global market share, they are now looking for a Finance Data Analyst with a finance background to help with the efficiency of the Internal Audit team.

about the job
This role is to support the IA team. You will analyse mass data and pinpoint trends, patterns, anomalies to improve effectiveness, identify areas of risk, etc. You will use visualisation dashboards to create charts and graphs in a meaningful and attractive way. You will use data analytics tools and techniques to come up with financial modelling, data mining and predictive analysis to assist the IA team members in identifying key risk areas. You will be involved in automating repetitive tasks and doing data sanitization. You will work closely with the IT team to ensure data accuracy and availability which is crucial for reliable audit testing.

about the manager/team
You will be working together in a team of competent and proactive individuals. They are strong team players and would render you that helping hand whenever needed.

skills and experience required
You should be Degree qualified in Accountancy from a reputable university and possess at least 5 years of working experience in Finance related work and have used DA in a finance team. The work experience involves using data analytics tools such as SQL and Python, data visualisation dashboards such as Power BI and Tableau. You have exposure to new technology and robotic tools such as RPA and NLP to automate manual work. Knowledge in Business Intelligence such as Galvanize software and analytics tools like ACL, Oracle Transaction Business Intelligence will be highly advantageous. You should have good communications skills and be able to multi-task and work well under pressure.

To apply online please use the 'apply' function, alternatively you may contact Clara Oh. (EA R22111662)

title: Business Data Analyst (Banking)
company_info: As an international player in consulting and technologies and a specialist in Data and Digital, Keyrus is dedicated to helping enterprises take advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitate and accelerate their transformation, and generate new drivers of growth and competitiveness. Placing innovation at the heart of its strategy, Keyrus is developing a value proposition that is unique in the market and centered around an innovative offering founded upon a combination of three major and convergent areas of expertise: • Data Intelligence Data Science – Artificial Intelligence – Big Data & Cloud Analytics – Business Intelligence – EIM – CPM/EPM • Digital Experience Innovation & Digital Strategy – Digital Marketing – DMP & CRM – Digital Commerce – Digital Performance – User Experience • Management & Transformation Strategy & Innovation – Digital Transformation – Performance Management – Project Management Present in 20 countries on 4 continents, including Singapore, Shanghai, Hong-Kong, and Ho Chi Minh City, the Keyrus Group has 3,000 employees.
job_category: Banking and Finance, Consulting, Information Technology
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Keyrus is an international consulting firm, specializing in the integration of data intelligence and Digital solutions. With over 3000 employees spread across 20 countries, Keyrus continues to deliver on such projects to a wide range of clients from various industries including but not limited to Banking/Finance, Healthcare/pharmaceuticals, FMCG, Oil & Gas, and more.

As part of Keyrus’ solution delivery, we are also in a position to recruit and place technical consultants to complement on existing client projects with their expertise. As such, we seek innovative and agile people to support ambitious and forthcoming technological challenges.
Join the Keyrus team in Singapore as a Senior Business Analyst (Banking) and contribute to our client's success in the banking industry.
We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Business Analyst with a minimum of 10 years of industry experience. The ideal candidate should possess a strong background in financial instruments, investment fund accounting, and data management within the financial sector.

Responsibilities:
Conduct in-depth analysis of business processes, systems, and data related to financial instruments and investment funds.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and identify opportunities for process improvement and optimization.
Utilize your expertise in financial instruments and investment fund accounting to provide insightful recommendations and solutions.
Perform data analysis, validation, and reconciliation to ensure accuracy and integrity of financial information.
Develop comprehensive documentation, including functional specifications, test plans, and reports.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement new systems or enhancements, ensuring seamless integration and user adoption.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, regulations, and best practices related to financial instruments, accounting for investment funds, and data management.
Required skills and experience:
A minimum of 10 years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably within the financial services industry.
Strong knowledge of financial instruments, including equities, fixed income, derivatives, and alternative investments.
Expertise in investment fund accounting principles, regulations, and reporting requirements.
Familiarity with data management concepts, including data governance, data quality, and data integration.
Proficient in using industry-standard tools for data analysis, such as SQL, Excel, and data visualization software.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team

title: Data Analyst, Bloomberg Data Management Services - Singapore
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Bloomberg Data Management Services delivers the world’s foremost Data Utility to the Financial Markets. Our clients experience immediate improvement in Data Quality, Operational Process & Control, Reaction to Change and Data Governance when they on-board to our Private Cloud - Hosted Service.
At Bloomberg Data Management Services, you will have the opportunity to go above and beyond as well as work on interesting challenging projects with a number of key partners both internally and externally. We are passionate about people who are excited by innovation, who care about our customers, and to achieve our mission to “Simplify Data Management”
What’s the role?
Bloomberg Data Management Services is an Enterprise Data Management (EDM) and Index Data Management (IDM) business, providing simplified data management solutions to the financial industry. We are seeking a motivated self-starter to join our Data Operations team. Based in the Singapore office you will assist with the operational support of managed service clients, initially undertaking the daily operational tasks of handling the acquisition and cleansing of data from the many multi-vendor sources.
We'll trust you to:
Respond to ad-hoc queries from customers and ensure that a high-quality service is provided to our clients according to defined Service Level Agreements (SLAs)
Monitor the receipt of financial data feeds from third-party vendors, as well as client’s proprietary data.
Investigate and resolve exceptions on a variety of client activities such as Security Master, Price Master, Index Master, Legal Entity Master and Corporate Actions.
Research data quality issues, identify resolutions and update systems as required
Drive data quality through continuous process improvement and lead changes to workflow activities when necessary
Participate in user acceptance testing during initial on-boarding of managed service clients
You'll need to have:
A bachelor's degree or higher in relevant data technology or financial field, or degree-equivalent qualifications
2-5 years of recent support experience in financial markets, including exchanges, market data providers or financial institutions
Demonstrated experience working with market data feeds, for example monitoring the real-time market data feed from vendors
Demonstrated experience in Data management, for example driving data quality and identifying a solution to help customers and find efficiencies
Comfort with a high degree of autonomy, and shown ability in managing priorities from multiple internal and external partners
Strong analytic and problem-solving skills
Ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines
A desire to learn, be data-oriented with a strong work ethic
The ability to multitask and be organized, detail-oriented
Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organisation
Strong presentation and communication skills in English
We'd love to see:
Experience with data across multiple types of data products such as Reference, Pricing, ESG data amongst others from providers such as Bloomberg, Refinitiv, Intercontinental Exchange, MSCI ESG, S&P etc.
Fluency in Japanese business language will an added advantage for coverage of Japanese clients
If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional
Why Bloomberg?
We’re individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and experiences who take on big challenges and create even bigger impact through our work. We’re interested in what makes you you, and how we can create opportunities for you to channel your unique, personal energy and grow to your fullest potential.
Learn more about our office and benefits
Singapore | www.bloomberg.com/singapore
Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, parental or caring status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or maternity/parental leave, protected veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other classification protected by applicable law.
Bloomberg provides reasonable adjustment/accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable adjustment/accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable adjustment/accommodation include but are not limited to making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you would prefer to discuss this confidentially, please email AMER_recruit@bloomberg.net(Americas), EMEA_recruit@bloomberg.net(Europe, the Middle East and Africa), or APAC_recruit@bloomberg.net(Asia-Pacific), based on the region you are submitting an application for.

title: Data Analyst
company_info: We are Iris Back in 1999, six entrepreneurs became bored of big agency politics and frustrated by bureaucracy. They decided to create a new kind of agency. One that could innovate around client needs and, in turn, help clients to innovate around business and consumer needs. Today Iris is a diverse, thriving creative network. Our 1,000 people across 14 offices work with some of the most adventurous and successful clients in the world. Our ambition is to be the most inspiring and innovative agency network on the planet. We are built for today's challenges 89% of advertising is not noticed or remembered. 3 out of 4 brands are failing to build emotional engagement. Today’s consumer is able to live within their own networks, on their own terms. And if they’re not ignoring you, they’re actively blocking you. Brands no longer influence people. People do. We build Participation Brands A new breed of brand has become more ingrained in people’s lives than ever before. By actively enhancing lifestyles, passion points and popular culture they get their market doing their marketing. They are Participation Brands. And we’ve been building them for 18 years. We are all about the blend At Iris we have no dominant ‘discipline gene’, no departmental silos and no personal ego. Just a diverse array of specialists operating in a no borders, no boundaries, no bullshit environment. Our emphasis on ‘The Blend’ means we’re constantly mixing and matching talent to create the right integrated team on each project. We are part of something bigger Iris is part of Cheil Worldwide - the world’s 15th biggest agency company with a network of 55 offices and over 5,000 people. Our partnership with Cheil provides Iris with an extensive global reach, breadth of skill sets, people and technology. And importantly, for our clients it means the experience of a smaller local agency with the resource of a large global one. We currently deliver global to local work for Diageo, Philips, Samsung, Shell and adidas.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Iris
We’re Iris. We’re For the Forward. A creative, strategy and innovation company that uses the power of participation to excite progress for businesses. As part of the team, we’re inviting you to participate in progress – moving yourself and the world forward with every decision you make.
Our office
Our bustling office in the business district of Singapore proudly embodies the best of Iris within the APAC region. Home to an eclectic team of 50 with deep specialisms, we are proud to be the creative agency of record for Trust Bank, Alcon, GoTyme and other leading brands in the region.

What are we looking for?
The Data Driven Marketing function at Iris helps our clients leverage data and analytics to create impactful marketing programs. We’re looking for a strong Data Analyst to join our Data Driven Marketing team & turn the wealth of data into insights for enhanced measurement, effective customer targeting and driving marketing efficiency.
Your responsibilities as a Data Analyst will be to:
Work as part of the core Data Driven Marketing team driving our client’s growth & CRM marketing programs.
Perform Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) process for monthly, quarterly and annual reporting, optimise / automate current ETL process.
Design & Visualize reports and dashboards that help our clients effectively track their marketing & growth performance against OKRs.
Perform data audits on the client’s data stack and recommend strategies for improving their data-readiness to leverage their First-party data.
Leverage Iris’s proprietary frameworks for effective measurement of client’s KPIs & KPDs.
Work with the global Iris network (our data specialists in the UK & US) to build capabilities, new skillsets, share knowledge and support where necessary.
Support the in-house CRM & Performance Marketing Team with insights rooted in data to generated informed recommendations to clients.
Support the delivery of all key projects through data analytics, reporting & insights.
Who are you?
You have at least 2 years of experience of working as a data analyst or data engineer (preferred).
You are a great team player - one that celebrates wins of your team & team mates more than yours.
You have strong hands-on experience in advanced analytics using SQL and Python.
You have technical skills in advanced Excel, visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI.
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving.
You can describe the analysis approach and insights in a manner that can be clearly understood by audience with different levels of data understanding.
You have experience in designing, developing, and applying advanced analytics & reporting solutions to solve commercial and marketing challenges.

Who are we?
The Iris Character
We have five core behaviours that we look for to help us to build a culture that fosters true progress: Courage, Storytelling, Collaboration, Empathy and Commitment.
What’s in it for you?
Core hours (10am-4pm)
Health care insurance
Doctor Anywhere
Dental care
Mental health assistance
Holiday
20 days per annum
Agency closure from Christmas Eve to New Year’s Day
Plus your birthday day off
Plus an extra day each year after 3 years of service, capped at 3 additional days
Smoke break privilege

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion
We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer and recruit on talent alone, regardless of age, ethnicity, religion, education, class, sexual orientation or disability. We champion diversity and believe it not only benefits but enhances our creativity, our company and society at large. We are For the Forward.
‘For the Free’ is our global DE&I strategy. Its aim is to create a business where everyone feels free to be themselves and has the same opportunity and access to progress. Our DE&I strategy encourages courageous thinkers who champion outsider perspectives. ‘For the Free’ has three main pillars of activity:
Diversity - We want to invite difference. To be an organisation that is fully representative of different groups and reflects the city, country and world that we live in. We value our talents’ lived experiences – including gender, race, class, disability, neuro-diversity and sexual orientation.
Equity - We want to be fair to everyone. To remove barriers for individuals and groups and provide the bespoke access, support and opportunities that are needed to fully participate in our organisation. We are levelling the playing field.
Inclusion - We want everyone to feel at home. To provide a place where people can be themselves, express their unique identity and contribute to the life of our community.
If this interests you, then we want you!
Send us your CV and we’ll get in touch.

Roles & Responsibilities
To apply, It will be great if you could share your CV to hoonteck.tan@randstad.com.sg. Alternatively, you can apply at https://lnkd.in/gD5_k-Rc

Opportunity to lead transformation through data analytics
1st headcount in Data team
About the company
Our client is an established corporation with large investments in technology. Due to rapid expansion, they are looking for a new Data Senior Manager to be based here in Singapore.

About the job
You will be responsible for:
Designing and execution of advanced analytics and data platforms. You will contribute to establishing and enforcing efficient operational processes, data conduits, protocols, and industry-standard procedures, all in alignment with the company infrastructure and security regulations, ensuring the continuous monitoring, security, availability, and reliability of these platforms.
Oversee end-to-end project management for data platform initiatives, ensuring their successful completion in accordance with project objectives.
Manage the entire lifecycle of machine learning processes.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define project scope, objectives, and deliverables that align with the university's desired outcomes.
Develop and maintain comprehensive project plans, encompassing timelines, resource allocation, and interdependencies.
Monitor project advancement, identify potential risks, and proactively apply strategies to mitigate them.
Coordinate with interdisciplinary teams to ensure transparent communication, cooperation, and consistency throughout each phase of the project.
Serve as the primary contact point for both internal and external stakeholders, providing regular project updates and addressing any concerns or issues that may arise.
Facilitate project-related meetings, such as kick-off sessions, progress reports, and post-project evaluations.
Promote the implementation of best practices, methodologies, and tools to enhance project management efficiency.
Collaborate with data stewards and data analysts to construct data pipelines that collect information from enterprise systems, handling both batch and real-time streaming data.
Oversee the entire lifespan of a data platform project, from collecting requirements to data modeling, designing data architecture, and deployment.

Skills and experience required

As a successful applicant, you will have experience in data architecture, data modeling, data governance, and applying business acumen to implement data platforms.

Hands-on expertise in deploying Data Lake and Data Warehouse solutions using technologies such as Snowflake, Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, SQL Database, and AWS Lake Formation.
Exposure to DevOps tools like AWS Cloud Formation, Terraform, Docker, and Git for continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) development.

Whats on offer

This is an excellent opportunity to lead transformation projects through data analytics. You will have strong support from business to lead this transformation.

To apply, It will be great if you could share your CV to hoonteck.tan@randstad.com.sg. Alternatively, you can apply at https://lnkd.in/gD5_k-Rc (EA: 94C3609/ R1219669)

Role is a Risk Analyst to perform BAU support for a risk data mart that is providing data to Basel III LCR reporting, Basel Credit Risk management reporting, Credit Risk management reporting.

title: Data Analyst
company_info: Rapsodo is a sports analytics company that empowers athletes and coaches to analyze and improve their game, with affordable, portable, easy-to-use, data-driven sports technologies. In 2010, our founder and Chief Executive Officer Batuhan Okur registered Rapsodo Pte. Ltd. in Singapore. Our journey began with the development of the first affordable personal golf launch monitor, distributed in the USA under SkyTrak. Since then we have continued to transform into a leading sports data and technology company with the vision to help athletes reach their full potential. Our data-driven, performance measurement tools empower athletes to achieve their best regardless of what skill level they are at.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Rapsodo Inc. is a sports technology and analytics company that uses computer vision and machine learning to help all athletes maximize their performance. Our proprietary technology applications range from helping golfers of all abilities, including PGA professionals, to optimize their launch conditions, to allowing MLB pitchers to increase the efficiency on their breaking balls.
Current partners include all 30 MLB teams, MLB, USA Baseball, Golf Digest, PGA of America, and over 1,000 NCAA athletic departments.
Rapsodo is actively seeking a dedicated Data Analyst to bolster our data-driven decision-making. We are on the lookout for candidates with a flair for diving into complex data sets and converting them into actionable insights.
Key Responsibilities
Oversee data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing, ensuring data quality for insightful analysis.
Employ advanced statistical techniques to distill meaningful insights from complex data sets.
Collaborate with diverse teams to comprehend business issues and devise data-driven solutions.
Convey findings and recommendations to stakeholders effectively using visualizations, reports, and dashboards.
Conduct experiments to assess hypotheses, evaluate models, and optimize operations.
Work closely with our software engineers and BIT teams to develop and implement cutting-edge algorithms.
Stay current with the latest trends in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical techniques.
Experience & Qualifications
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Statistics.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Experience in data manipulation, cleaning, and preprocessing techniques.
Knowledge in statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and experiment design.
Familiarity with a broad range of machine learning algorithms, techniques, and libraries.
Capable of creating compelling data visualizations using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to manage large data sets.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills.
An inquisitive mindset, coupled with a desire for continuous learning and growth.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us
The National Cancer Centre Singapore (NCCS) is a leading national and regional tertiary cancer centre, attending to the majority of cancer cases in Singapore’s public healthcare sector. We offer world class oncology care by having the best talent, doing robust clinical and translational research and leading education efforts to improve cancer outcomes. Join us to build a meaningful career and offer patients hope for a cancer-free tomorrow.

About the Role
You will be part of the Department of Cancer Informatics that seeks to support clinical and research activities of NCCS by providing leadership in Cancer Informatics, rationalizing current & future IT clinical application resources to present an integrated, practical and user-friendly interface for clinician use. As a Clinical Data Analyst, you will be involved in the development, implementation, evaluation and operational aspects of clinical database projects, as well as data and quality management of clinical database.

Some of the Key Responsibilities Include
Perform clinical data abstraction, data quality management, and data entry & coding using appropriate classification systems
Analyse and interpret cancer trends such as analysing and interpreting disease and survival trends, undertaking statistical modelling to assess impact of health promotion programmes
Provide support in the planning & developing of cancer-related data collection systems, maintaining of policies & procedures and reports
Attend and record minutes of department meetings & various workgroups, and participate actively in institutional activities

Job Requirements
Degree in Nursing, Health Sciences, Biomedical Sciences or equivalent with 2 years of relevant of working experience
Prior experience in the field of clinical database project or clinical coding or health-related data analytics or data management in clinical research project would be an advantage
Experience in predictive analytics and proficiency with using R/Python, SPSS, STATA and Tableau will be an advantage
Organized, meticulous and independent with good interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
Resourceful and creative in problem solving and ability to handle multiple projects
Proficient in Microsoft Office
