description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About EDHEC Business School
EDHEC Business School, one of Europe’s leading business schools and a member of the select group of institutions worldwide to have earned all three international academic accreditations (AACSB, EQUIS, AMBA). Since 2001, EDHEC Business School has been pursuing an ambitious policy in terms of international research. This policy, known as “Research for Business”, aims to make EDHEC an academic institution of reference for the industry in a small number of areas in which the school has reached critical mass in terms of expertise and research results.

About the EDHEC Singapore Infrastructure Investment Institute
The creation of the EDHEC Singapore Infrastructure Investment Institute springs from the past 4 years of research on infrastructure investment at EDHEC-Risk Institute and the continuous support of the Monetary Authority of Singapore in supporting cutting hedge research that can bring new and valuable knowledge to institutional investors, asset managers and regulators. Based in Singapore, EDHEC infra aims to create a global repository of financial knowledge and investment benchmarks about infrastructure equity and debt investment, with a focus on delivering applied research in finance for investors in infrastructure. We aim to deliver the best available estimates of financial performance and risks of reference portfolios of privately held infrastructure investments, and thus provide investors with important insights about their strategic asset allocation choices to infrastructure, as well as support the adequate calibration of the relevant prudential frameworks. EDHEC infra benefits from unparalleled access to the financial data of infrastructure projects and firms, especially private data, that is either unavailable to market participants or too cumbersome and difficult to collect and aggregate. We also bring advanced asset pricing and risk measurement technology designed to answer investors’ information needs about long-term investment in privately held infrastructure, from asset allocation to prudential regulation and performance attribution and monitoring.
EDHEC Singapore Infrastructure Investment Institute, part of EDHEC Business School is looking for an analyst to help develop a database of infrastructure project financial statements under the supervision of the Institute’s Head of Data Collection (ACCA).

The position
This is an opportunity for recent graduate with accounting, finance or economics majors to develop in-depth knowledge of infrastructure projects and the financial arrangements that support them. Beginning with the analysis and input of financial statements, the role will require research and analysis of infrastructure projects, and companies with a focus on collecting and updating financial data in the largest worldwide database of unlisted infrastructure assets.
The candidate must be detail oriented with a willingness to learn. An understanding of financial accounts is desirable and willing to spend time reading detailed project documentation to extract the relevant information and populate a data file. Prior knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite is essential. Knowledge of a European language would be an advantage.
This is a full-time, on-going position.
Remuneration is competitive and includes a bonus for meeting performance objectives.
Attractive salary and bonus, healthcare and pension plan coverage.
The salary will be determined according to EDHEC's pay scale, the candidate's qualifications and experience.
To apply for this offer, please send a CV and a cover letter to: recruitment@edhec-dbd.com.
To know more about EDHECinfra: https://edhec.infrastructure.institute/mission

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Principal IT Consultant (Data Platforms and Analytics)
You will be involved in architecting, implementing, managing, and running advanced analytics and data platforms. You will assist to establish and implement effective operational workflows, data pipelines, procedures, and best practices in accordance with the company’s infrastructure and security policies to ensure that the platforms are monitored, secure, available, and reliable.
Responsibilities:
Manage the full life cycle of a data platform project from requirement gathering to data modelling, design of the data architecture and deployment.
Define project scope, objectives, and deliverables in collaboration with stakeholders.
Develop and maintain project plans, including timelines, resource allocation, and dependencies.
Monitor project progress, identify risks, and proactively implement mitigation strategies.
Establish and manage the complete machine learning lifecycle.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure clear communication, collaboration, and alignment throughout the project lifecycle.
Act as the main point of contact for internal and external stakeholders, providing regular project updates and addressing any concerns or issues.
Facilitate project meetings, including kick-off meetings, status updates, and post-mortem reviews.
Drive the implementation of best practices, processes, and tools for efficient project management.
Collaborate with data stewards, and data analysts to build data pipelines to ingest data from enterprise systems for both batch and real-time streaming data.
Requirements:
Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related disciplines.
At least 5 years in project management with a focus on data platform projects.
Hands-on experience in implementing Data Lake/Data Warehouse with technologies like – Snowflakes, Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, SQL Database, AWS Lake formation is a MUST.
Strong knowledge of project management methodologies and tools, such as Agile or Scrum.
Experience in data architecture, data modelling, data governance, and business knowledge implementing data platforms.
Experience working with a variety of software and services vendors, including SaaS and other cloud-based solutions.
Comfortable with DevOps tools like AWS Cloud Formation/Terraform, Docker and Git for CI/CD development.
Familiar in building REST services is good to have.
PMP or equivalent and architecture qualifications (i.e. TOGAF) will be of added advantage.
Strong communication skills (written and verbal) and ability to discuss strategy at the C-level.

Roles & Responsibilities
Job
The Senior Data Engineer owns, supports, and improves the data capabilities in terms of collecting, managing, and converting raw data into information that can be interpreted by data analysts and data scientists.
The goals will be to define, build and improve the architecture, tools and procedures for data pipelining, functional and unit testing to enhancing reporting and advanced analytics in an ever-changing data infrastructure. They will have to communicate effectively to a non-technical audience that includes a wide range of customers from various countries and business lines.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Own and build the end-to-end data orchestration of the Data Platform
• Build the data pipeline and have an optimal ETL process to populate a reporting optimized database using Microsoft Azure
• Monitor and manage data pipelines, ensuring data accuracy and stability
• Design the architecture, build, and deploy the data platform that provide intuitive analytics across the business
• Design and grow the data platform to support a variety of data use case (batch analysis, real-time analytics, data science …)
• Define, improve, and apply a Data governance framework
• Collaborate with the business teams, challenge them functionally on their new needs and analyse the technical feasibility
• Evangelize the releases to user, gathering feedback and tracking usage to improve future evolution
• Identify and improve delivery (data project management, automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing architecture for greater scalability …)
• Enliven the local data community
• Identify use-cases and collaborate with eQ on potential projects
• Implement DevOps platform, framework, tools and continuous improvement/continuous delivery for data engineering projects

REQUIREMENTS
• Bachelor’s degree or above in data engineering, IT, computer science, or related field
• 6-8 years of experience of which at least 1 year managing a small team
• Demonstrated experience in a similar role, using Microsoft Azure
• Proficient in SQL and Python
• Strong analytical skills, with keen attention to detail
• Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
• Ability to prioritize own and others time and workload

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Role Description
The Data Engineer supports the implementation of data structure and architecture, master/meta-data management approach and data quality programme to facilitate access to data and information. He/She support the design, implementation and maintenance of data flow channels and data processing systems that support the collection, storage, batch and real-time processing, and analysis of information from structured and unstructured sources in a scalable, repeatable and secure manner. He/She implements data management standards and practices.

Responsibilities
(a) Work with stakeholders to understand needs for data structure, availability, scalability and accessibility
(b) Support translation of data business needs into technical system requirements
(c) Identify opportunities for improvements and optimisation
(d) Build data flow channels and processing systems to extract, transform, load and integrate data from various sources
(e) Develop complex code, scripts and data pipelines to process structured and unstructured data
(f) Work with data analysts, data scientists and other analytics stakeholders to implement data models to support analytics use cases
(g) Make data science code production ready to ensure it is maintainable, scalable and debuggable. Deploy machine learning models to production and build the framework to monitor the performance of the model.
(h) Assist with integration of data systems into existing infrastructure
(i) Test data system configurations to increase efficiency
(j) Support the handling and logging of errors
(k) Monitor data system performance
(l) Automate data collection and analysis processes
(m) Develop tools to improve data flows between internal/external systems and the data lake/warehouse
(n) Contribute to defining data retention policies
(o) Able to administer, design, develop, validate, deploy and maintain ETL tool such as Informatica, IBM Datastage, Talend

Requirements / Qualifications
Requirements
(a) Degree/Master in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or equivalent.
(b) At least seven (3) years’ experience in providing data warehouse or advanced analytics solutions, especially in designing large Big Data technologies or analytics solutions.
(c) Demonstrate good, in-depth knowledge in relevant Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) hardware/software products, frameworks and methodologies.
(d) Experience with at least two of the following areas:
· databases (e.g. Oracle, MS SQL, MySQL, Teradata)
· big data (e.g. Hadoop ecosystem)
· ETL development using ETL tools (e.g. Informatica, IBM Datastage, Talend)
· data repository design (e.g. operational data stores, dimensional data stores, data marts)
· data interrogation techniques (e.g. SQL, NoSQL).
· structured and unstructured data analytics.
· batch and real-time data ingestion and processing
· data quality tools and processes.
· data transformation and terminology equivalence mapping.
(e) Experience in data modelling for analytics (e.g. star schemas, snowflake schemas).
(f) Experience with data acquisition tools (e.g., ETL, real-time data capture, and change data capture).
(g) Experience in interacting with analytics stakeholders (economists, statisticians, clinicians, policy makers) on a business or domain level
(h) Deep understanding of analytical models and methodologies – especially in the context of health analytics for clinical use and clinical safety (e.g. data mining, predictive analytics) would be preferred.
(i) Comfortable working independently to carry out data analysis, estimate data quality and sufficiency. Understanding and analysing huge volumes of data drawn from heterogeneous sources / repositories. Experience in working with Big Data technologies / solutions would be preferred.
(j) Good interpersonal skills, a detail-oriented & flexible person who can work across different areas within the team.
(k) A good understanding of Singapore Tourism would be preferred.
(l) Familiarity or experience with visitor informatics would be preferred.
(m) An understanding of tourism data governance, data acquisition and data management would be an advantage.

Our global platform allows you to have more mobility, choices and opportunities to contribute than you ever imagined. It all adds up to the perfect opportunity to take your career further with us.
description:

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Allegis Global Solutions is the exclusive Contingent HR services provider for one of the world’s leading banks.
At Allegis Global Solutions we’re proud to be the leader in global talent solutions. We draw upon decades of industry expertise to develop innovative tools, products, processes and strategies focused on outcome. Moreover, we’re incredibly proud to have built a culture that empowers our people to make their mark while making deep connections that will last a lifetime. With our passion and culture for talent, we are truly transforming the way the World acquires talent.
Our Client is one of the world's most international banks with over 1,100 branches, offices and outlets in 67 countries. They operate in some of the world's most dynamic markets and have been for over 150 years. More than 90 per cent of their income and profits are derived from Asia, Africa and the Middle East. Their brand promise, Here for good, underlines their distinctive approach.

The Financial Markets (FM) Data Management team is looking for a leader with a proven track-record in resolving data quality issues in a complex financial institution. This strong minded individual needs to be technically sound, with a proven track-record of delivery, to join our Data Quality Analytics programme. The role requires tackling key data issues that impact regulatory regimes, setting out an architectural roadmap for the application, growing the team to meet the ever-increasing demand, partnering with the business to ensure adequate ownership and implementing an operating model to gain insight in DQ issues, identify root cause, and resolve.
Key Responsibilities:
Defining the technical roadmap of the application linked to the business strategy.
Ensuring that the application is compliant with all relevant technology and project standards.
Ensuring that strategy for security entitlements, retention, record keeping, and audit trail is clear and there is plan to implement.
Manage governance and prioritisation with the Product Owner.
Liaise with key data sources to source data required to conduct analytics to meet business timeframes.
Partnering with the business to define and implement an operating model to fix data at source.
Oversight of business requirements and design implementation in the tool.
Oversee and approve the testing strategy and control framework for the application ensuring any risks are captured in the risk framework and managed to completion.
Ensuring adequate handover to production support teams to ensure production stability and troubleshooting.
Ensuring the application has the appropriate release mgt processes in place to have frequent and safe releases.
Identify opportunities to utilise and implement machine learning.
Provide business cases and insights into opportunities for cost and control improvements related to data quality.
Regulatory & Business Conduct
· Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct.
· Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across the Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
· Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate, and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
Requirements:
Good educational background, ideally to degree or equivalent level.
8 to 12 years’ experience working in a Financial Markets domain and extensive experience in; solving data problems at source, data profiling, big data technology, data governance and data analytics.
Critical thinking and problem solving and explaining multiple solutions, assessing relative strengths and weaknesses, and justifying solutions for approval
Experience in data policy, data governance and data dictionaries.
MIFID2/SFTR/CFTC/EMIR/SEC regulations knowledge.
Experience in creating target operating model (TOM) design and implementation
Technical knowledge of data visualization like Tableau/Power BI
Knowledge of data management including, ability to analyse data lineage, data quality governance, best practices for data quality resolution.
Understanding of Investment Banking products, Domain and Trade life cycle.
Experience with Agile methodology
Excellent verbal communication skills; facilitating working meetings, building rapport with stakeholders.
big data technologies (Hadoop, Hive, NiFI, Spark), rules engines and regulatory applications.
Business Analyst skills

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities;
Manage a team of data scientists and data analysts
Work closely with business users of the group to build a strong pipeline of impactful projects. This will involve understanding business challenges, evaluating the use cases, scoping the problems, and developing business cases on how to turn data into critical information and knowledge which can then translate into business decisions and actions
Scope, design, develop, deploy, and maintain data science enabled applications and data analytics applications across the organization
Support the professional growth and development of data scientists and data analysts in your team
Educate and share data analytics and data science knowledge with various departments
Organise and guide your team to execute the pipeline of data science and data analytics projects. This involves,
- Perform data cleaning, pre-processing, and feature engineering to build machine learning models
- Iterate with key users to perform subsequent deep dives based on initial results and fine-tuning the models
- Build automation applications or APIs to call the models

Requirements;
A Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Computer Science/Engineering, Data Science, Statistics, or Applied Mathematics
At least 3 years of relevant experience, in data science, machine learning, and statistical modeling, preferably with experience managing a data science team
Proven track record of successfully leading data science projects and guiding a team of data scientists
Have strong analytical, conceptualization, and problem-solving skills. Able to take broad, strategic perspectives
Excellent problem-solving abilities with a demonstrated aptitude for translating business requirements into analytical solutions
Understand key concepts, techniques, and considerations in statistics, machine learning, and data analytics
Proficiency in machine learning techniques, including regression, classification, clustering, ensemble, and deep learning
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, and SQL, along with experience working with large-scale big-data processing frameworks
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts clearly and effectively
Strong team management skills who can motivate and grow the team and has strong organization skills. Effective in setting and managing individual and team KPIs and goals

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a Power BI experienced Data Analyst with a passion for data transformation, dashboard creation, and delivering actionable insights. You will play a pivotal role in configuring, extracting, transforming, and loading data from various sources into Power BI environments to create compelling dashboards and reports. Your expertise will uncover patterns and trends, utilizing data mining and statistical techniques to extract insights and provide actionable recommendations.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs, processes, and procedures.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications for data analytics purposes.
Automate procedures to seamlessly transform data from diverse sources into Power BI.
Be responsible for designing, building, publishing, and scheduling Power BI solutions while maintaining and supporting data analytics platforms.
Develop and update technical documentation to ensure clarity and consistency in processes and solutions.
Provide monthly administrative reporting to track progress and performance.
Offer technical support for Power BI solutions, addressing any issues or concerns.
Collaborate effectively within a team or work independently with minimal supervision.

Requirements:

Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, Statistics, or a related field.
At least 3 years of hands-on experience in using Power BI to develop dashboards, reports, and enterprise analytics solutions.
Proficiency in Excel, VBA, Power Query, or other data modeling tools.
Strong knowledge of Data Modeling/ETL (Extraction, Transformation & Loading).
Familiarity with Microsoft SQL Server, tools, and technologies.
Experience in Python, R, or other analytics tools (e.g., Tableau) and languages is a plus.

company_info: RegASK is a global RegTech company provides regulatory consulting services by leveraging their in-house AI based platform capability combined with regulatory team expertise for devising path-to market, path to claim, market expansion etc. strategies for FMCG, MedTech, Pharma companies across the globe. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
OUR COMPANY
We, at RegASK are a high growth global RegTech company leveraging technology and global network of experts to revolutionize regulatory intelligence, serving the LifeSciences (MedTech, CROs, Pharma) and FMCG industries (Food, Personal Care). RegASK team is highly diverse with more than 10 nationalities across 3 continents, entrepreneurial and very agile, enjoying the benefits of working across industries and across the globe. RegASK just completed its series A funding round in December 2022 and is currently recruiting highly motivated talents to expand its team and support its ambitious growth plans.

RegASK is an international, diverse and rewarding place to work. If you are a builder, highly autonomous in your working style, and eager to problem solve, we would love to hear from you.

RegASK is part of Sprim Global Investments portfolio, a group of 500+ people in 19 offices across 6 continents, finding solutions, discovering and implementing new ideas to deliver better health.


THE POSITION
Data Analyst
As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in transforming complex data into actionable insights through the creation of dynamic dashboards. Your expertise in data visualization and analysis will contribute to enhancing decision-making processes for both internal teams and external customers.
Responsibilities:
Engage with both internal stakeholders and customers to clearly comprehend and define data requirements, objectives, and deliverables.
Source, collect, clean, and preprocess data from a diverse range of sources to support internal decision-making as well as customer-facing products.
Design, develop, and maintain robust data models, databases, and dashboards that serve dual purposes: tracking internal KPIs and providing value to customers.
Execute exploratory data analysis to unearth trends, correlations, and anomalies, translating these findings into actionable insights for internal strategies and customer solutions.
Utilize statistical analyses and data visualization tools to present complex data in a simplified, clear, and actionable manner to both internal teams and external customers.
Actively collaborate with cross-functional teams, including customer success and product management, to co-create data-driven strategies and recommendations that align with customer needs.
Rigorously monitor and validate data integrity and quality across all dashboards and reports, ensuring that both internal stakeholders and customers can rely on the accuracy of the data presented.
Transform business and customer questions into structured analytical approaches, offering data-based insights that inform decision-making processes.
Remain up-to-date with the latest industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analytics, with a focus on dashboard development and customer-centric analytics.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field. Master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience (3+ years) as a Data Analyst, preferably in a data-rich environment.
Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, or similar.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or others.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and methodologies.
Excellent communication skills to convey findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Problem-solving mindset with the ability to develop creative solutions to data challenges.
How to Apply:
If you are excited about this opportunity and believe you have the skills and qualifications to excel as our Data Analyst, please submit your resume for consideration.

We appreciate all applications, but only selected candidates will be contacted for an interview.

Thank you for considering joining the RegASK team. We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Regional Data Analyst, Service
company_info: EPSON SINGAPORE PTE LTD Epson Singapore Pte Ltd was established in October 1982 as Epson Electronics (Singapore) Pte Ltd, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Seiko Epson Corporation, Japan, with the objective of promoting the sales and marketing of Epson printers in the region. In 1987, our business scope was expanded to include the sale of electronic components and system devices. The company was subsequently renamed Epson Singapore Pte Ltd in 1988. Our product portfolio saw rapid expansion in the following years to include more IT based products such as colour inkjet printers, scanners, digital cameras, large format printers, laser printers and serial impact dot matrix printers that cater to both business and personal user environments. In recent years, we have also successfully entered the competitive market of visual instruments with highly-sophisticated LCD projectors and peripherals as well as system devices such as crystal oscillators, camera modules, D-TED colour LCD modules, ultra-compact TFT LCD modules, LCD modules, LCD drivers and ASIC/System LSI microcomputers. Then there are also the highly regarded Epson Point-Of-Sales receipt printers that have been holding a worldwide leadership position. The attainment of ISO 9001 and ISO 14001 certifications in November 1997 and March 2000 respectively is a reflection as well as an affirmation of our commitment to excellent product quality and good corporate citizenship. Epson Singapore is committed to complying with the Environmental Policy established. January 2001 marked an exciting milestone in the new millennium for Epson Singapore when we were accorded the status of regional headquarters. With that move, our regional sales network was substantially enlarged to include countries in Southeast Asia with the highest economic growth potential. Most recently in April 2012, Epson Singapore was made the regional sales and service headquarters for our world-rernowned factory automation robots. Our regional product sales now cover Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Indochina and the South Asian nation of Pakistan. Epson Singapore is proud to be part of the rapid economic growth of the region that could only come about because of sound economic policies, dedicated workforces and the pervasive use of IT in government, industry, business and in homes. Epson first started life in Suwa, Japan in 1942 as "Daiwa Kogyo" - a company making wristwatch parts for its parent company, Seiko. The Epson name was subsequently derived in 1975 from the idea of the company being the offspring ("son") of the innovative and successful EP-101, the world's smallest electronic printer (EP) which was created by the company in 1968. This revolutionary commercial printer was developed from the world's first digital printing timer that was specially designed for the Tokyo Olympics in 1964.
description:

Job Summary

Critical Work Experience

Qualifications

title: Data Analyst
company_info: Professional Services and Staffing Solutions for administrative, clerical and support services along with IT support.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Min 3 years of experience.
At least 5 years of data-related working experience, with at least 3 years of hands-on experience in data management and data analytics in the finance, investment, banking, and asset management industries.
Good understanding of the principles, key controls and processes relating to data management.
Good at working with details and is meticulous in operations and tasks.
Good understanding of data modelling.
Good understanding on OLTP, Data Lake, Lakehouse technologies that may include knowledge of Snowflake, S3, AWS Glue, DeltaLake, DataBricks.
Good understanding of CI/CD pipelines, DevOps, DataOps, and their applicability in financial services.
Experience in working with databases using database technologies (e.g. MS SQL, Snowflake, Redshift and PostgreSQL) and data integration products (e.g. Informatica, Data Factory, Bash).
Extensive data-related experience in programming languages eg Python, SQL, Scala, Javascript, and similar.
Experience in working with business intelligence and data visualization tools e.g. Tableau, PowerBI.
Experience with SDLC methodology and/or agile methodologies like Scrum and Kanban and its related applications eg Confluence and JIRA.
Good team player, with strong analytical skills and enjoys complex problem solving.
Experience in data engineering platforms and virtualization eg Denodo, Jupyter, O365.
Excellent written and spoken English and strong presentation skillsets.
Strong inter-personal and people leadership skills to interact with diverse stakeholders.
Responsibilities:
Working closely with data analysts and business end-users to implement and support data platforms using best-of-breed technology and methodology.
Implement and design robust and scalable solutions to meet business needs and take operational considerations into account. Demonstrate technical expertise in the assigned areas.
Manage operations and maintain SLAs. Implement automation in data management. Collaborate with data engineering, architecture, and governance.
Perform data and metadata quality, modeling, lineage, cleansing, onboarding, registration, discoverability, access controls, migration, optimization, and cataloging. Execute, maintain and manage the whole data lifecycle.
Conduct requirement workshops with stakeholders, analyze and translate business and other requirements holistically into data strategies, plans, and actions.
Cover all aspects of data distribution and data service.
Design and implement scalable data pipelines and data service modules with robustness in mind to support the growing demands from business users.
Analyze and resolve day-to-day operational incidents and advisory to business users.
Listen to upstream changes, perform impact analysis and mitigate-modify-implement.
Do impact analysis, inform and distribute to downstream users and applications.
Analyze systems operations data (SLAs, customer satisfaction, delivery quality, team efficiency etc.) to identify actionable trends for continual improvements.
Data, application, and system checking and testing (eg UAT), CICD and go-live.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
about the company
Long standing history and strong global operations, this company has been growing aggressively organically and through acquisitions. Constantly innovating to meet the changing consumer needs and behaviours while expanding their global market share, they are now looking for a Data Analyst to help with the growing needs of the business.

about the job
This role is to support the IA team. You will analyst mass data and pinpoint trends, patterns, anomalies to improve effectiveness, identify areas of risk, etc. You will use visualisation dashboards to create charts and graphs in a meaningful and attractive way. You will use data analytics tools and techniques to come up with financial modelling, data mining and predictive analysis to assist the IA team members in identifying key risk areas. You will be involved in automating repetitive tasks and doing data sanitization. You will work closely with the IT team to ensure data accuracy and availability which is crucial for reliable audit testing.

about the manager/team
You will be working together in a team of competent and proactive individuals. They are strong team players and would render you that helping hand whenever needed.

skills and experience required
You should be Degree qualified in Accountancy from a reputable university and possess at least 5 years of working experience. The work experience involves using data analytics tools such as SQL and Python, data visualisation dashboards such as Power BI and Tableau. You have exposure on new technology and robotic tools such as RPA and NLP to automate manual work. Knowledge in Business Intelligence such as Galvanize software and analytics tools like ACL, Oracle Transaction Business Intelligence will be highly advantageous. You should have good communications skills and are able to multi-task and work well under pressure.

To apply online please use the 'apply' function, alternatively you may contact Clara Oh. (EA R22111662)

title: Data Engineer
company_info: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.
address: MAPLETREE BUSINESS CITY, 10 PASIR PANJANG ROAD 117438
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

As a Data Engineer in the Data Engineering team of GovTech’s Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Division, you will be building Whole-of-Government data infrastructure to power the insights needed for evidence-based decision-making and enhancing agencies’ service-delivery. You will be architecting, designing and building next-generation data infrastructure to galvanise digitalisation in the public sector.
We are looking for enthusiastic and passionate engineers to join us in this journey to make a difference.

What you will be working on:
Design and build resilient and efficient data pipelines for both batch and real-time streaming data
Architect and design data infrastructure on cloud using industry standard Infrastructure-as-Code tools
Execute projects with an Agile mindset
Build software frameworks to solve data problems at scale
Collaborate with product managers, software engineers, data analysts and data scientists to build scalable and data-driven platforms and tools
What we are looking for:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or have equivalent professional experience
Experience with data processing tools such as Spark, Beam, Flink
Experience with the cloud (e.g. AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience implementing batch and streaming data pipelines
Experience writing efficient SQL
In-depth knowledge of both SQL and NoSQL databases, including performance tuning and troubleshooting
Familiar with DevOps tools such as Git, Docker, Terraform
Experience in the public sector is a bonus
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round.
*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

title: Safety Data and Reporting Analyst (Jurong Island)
company_info: NES GLOBAL PTE. LTD. EA License Number: 08C4291
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Your role

Our major Oil & Energy Downstream Client is looking for Safety Data and Reporting Analyst to be based in Jurong Island and will be responsible for HSSE Data Reporting Process to meet Personal Safety and the Client's legal requirements internally and externally. You will meet all monthly, quarterly and annual reporting deadlines of HSSE reporting (e.g. sphera reports) to Clientt's PMR. You will support Site Sphera Focal for Weekly Site Sphera review through preparation and quality check of report.

Furthermore, you will conduct data analysis on Sphera entries to determine themes, risk areas for sharing with contractor partners. You will collect, reconcile and quality check of HSSE data to ensure delivery of timely quality HSSE data for the Client to Group and Government Regulators where required.

Verify the credibility of the HSSE data independently through knowledge of work-files, processes and collaboration with multi-disciplines
Analyse HSSE data and lead preparation of material to fold into reports on the Client's HSSE performance (e.g. weekly reports, monthly communication packs, SVP quarterly reports, monthly Peer Review)
Leverage data to understand and identify trends, provide insights and forecast trends on HSSE Performance to the Client's Leadership Team and DSM Group Reporting
Prepare HSSE documentation in meeting compliance and easy retrieval, for auditing and regulatory purposes
Participate as auditee for Group and Regulatory Conformance Audits, which includes providing clarifications and closing out audit actions
Strive for efficiencies and continuous improvement of HSSE data reporting process through use of automated reporting tools (e.g. data visualisation or database)
Support the Client's Safety Manager and HSSE advisors to interface with respective departments (i.e., Technology, Finance, Engineering, Operations) to ensure quality HSSE data and completion of other deliverables for reporting needs
Support HSSE cost activities including beginning-to-end finance related actions such as cost tracking, raising purchase requests and service entry sheets. Liaison with Aspri for Safety Training coordination matters, working closely with HSSE Advisors
Participate in briefing, discussion and consultation session with regulatory authorities to understand requirements from Authorities
Support as one HSSE Team on deliverance of site’s HSSE Campaigns/Communication initiatives (e.g. Monthly Safety Stand-down, Safety Day, ACT Programmes, Safety Video etc.) and HSSE related site Mission Critical Tactic (e.g. Safety Leadership MCT 2023)
Support the HSSE Department in applicable initiatives as and when required by the HSSE Manager
Support HSSE data related initiatives/projects to deploy and embed internal and regulatory changes to site reporting process and tools
HSSE cost monitoring and optimisation – including monitor, creating, vetting PO/PR for HSSE items and back up for Environmental items
Maintain good record keeping

You are what we are looking for if you:
Have working knowledge and experience of HSSE Management in oil & gas/refinery/petrochemical industry preferably
Are knowledgeable in PMR Personnel Safety data and reporting systems as well as local Personal Safety regulatory requirements under local authorities (i.e. MOM)
Have excellent data management skills and ability to integrate data across different platform
Are able to work under pressure to meet deadlines with a crowded and often changing business agenda
Have high level of accuracy in work product, attention to detail
Are willing to work additional hours and provide extended coverage during key reporting periods
Have strong English language communication skills (oral and written)
Have strong Microsoft Office skills including Powerpoint, Excel, Word, sharepoint and Power BI dashboard

title: Environment Data and Reporting Analyst (Bukom & Jurong Island)
company_info: NES GLOBAL PTE. LTD. EA License Number: 08C4291
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Your role

Our major Oil & Energy (Downstream) Client is looking for Environment Data and Reporting who will be based in Bukom and Jurong Island and be responsible for Energy and GHG Management as well as HSSE Data Reporting Process. You will ensure all quarterly and monthly reporting deadlines for Environment reporting are met. You will collect, reconcile and quality check of Environment data to ensure delivery of timely quality environmental data for Bukom/Jurong Island to Group/Government Regulators.

Furthermore, you will verify the credibility of the HSSE data independently through knowledge of work-files, processes and collaboration with multi-disciplines. You will analyse Environment data and prepare material to fold into reports on Bukom’s and Jurong Island's HSSE performance.

Leverage data to understand and identify trends, provide insights and understanding to Bukom and Jurong Island Leadership Team and DSM Group Reporting
Prepare Environment documentation in meeting compliance and easy retrieval, for auditing and verification purposes
Participate as auditee for Group and Regulatory Conformance Audits, which includes providing clarifications and closing out audit actions
Strive for efficiencies through use of automated reporting tools
Support Environment Specialists to interface with respective departments (i.e. Technology, Finance, Engineering, Operations) to ensure quality HSSE data and completion of other deliverables for reporting needs
Collect waste disposal data and (Optional) performing e-tracking for hazardous waste submission to NEA. This includes beginning-to-end finance related actions such as cost tracking, raising purchase requests and service entry sheets
Attend on-site briefing, discussion and consultation session with regulatory authorities to understand requirements from Authority
Support Environment Specialists in the deliverance of site’s Environment Campaigns and Communication initiatives
Support the HSSE Department in all other initiatives as and when required by the Environment Manager, Bukom and Jurong Island HSSE Managers

You are what we are looking for if you:

Are knowledgeable in oil & gas Standards (i.e. API Compendium, GRI) as well local regulatory requirements under local authorities (i.e. PUB and NEA) preferably
Have excellent data management skills and ability to integrate data across different platforms
Are able to work under pressure to meet deadlines with a crowded and often changing business agenda
Have high level of accuracy in work product, attention to detail
Are willing to work additional hours and provide extended coverage during key reporting periods
Have strong English language communication skills (oral and written)

title: Data Analyst Intern
company_info: As Asia’s leading ESG FinTech, STACS (Hashstacs Pte Ltd) is a Singapore-headquartered FinTech company focused on ESG FinTech, in partnership with the Monetary Authority of Singapore’s (MAS) Project Greenprint. Its flagship platform, ESGpedia, powers the ESG Registry of the MAS’ Project Greenprint. STACS serves as the Nexus of ESG Finance with its live blockchain infrastructure that enables effective Sustainable Finance, and unlocks value in Asset and Wealth Management and Digital Securities. Its clients and partners include global banks, stock exchanges, asset managers, corporates, and SMEs.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Company Description
STACS (Hashstacs Pte Ltd) is Asia’s leading ESG data and technology company, headquartered in Singapore. Its ESGpedia platform powers the Monetary Authority of Singapore’s (MAS) Greenprint ESG Registry and ASEAN Single Accesspoint for ESG Data (SAFE) Initiative. ESGpedia serves as the Nexus of ESG Finance with ESG data across multiple industries, as well as digital solutions for the financial sector to scale decarbonisation financing, and corporates and SMEs to attain their ESG goals. Empowering industries across Asia towards Net Zero, its clients and partners include global financial institutions, corporates, and SMEs.
STACS is an Award Winner of the MAS Global FinTech Innovation Challenge Awards 2020, and a two-time awardee of the Financial Sector Technology and Innovation (FSTI) Proof of Concept (POC) grant, under the Financial Sector Development Fund administered by the MAS. STACS is also an IMDA Spark company.

Job Summary
The data analyst intern will work closely with our Product team and business users on an end-to-end process to generate actionable business insights as part of the ESG solution of our core platform. The intern can expect to learn how to use the latest tools to perform data cleaning and data analytics for the sustainable industry.

Job Responsibilities
Your core responsibilities:
1. Improve the data collection and cleaning methods through automation
2. Identify relationships and correlation between different sustainability/ESG data sets for trend reports
3. Deliver Business Intelligence (BI) dashboards that visualize analytical results

Requirements
· Strong written and verbal communication skills
· Detail oriented and data driven, strong in problem solving skills
· Proficient with the use of MS Excel, Powerpoint, Word
· Basic coding knowledge, in any language (R, Javascript, Python) is preferred
· Basic coding knowledge of SQL is preferred

What you will need to thrive:
· Value teamwork above all.
· Natural curiosity to learn.
· Loves to work with code.
· Intrinsically motivated personality.
· High adaptability and strong problem-solving skills.
· Customer focused mindset.
· Self-starter who thrives on complexity and independence.

Intern experience sharing
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PDNAHrfoCKI

Notice
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. All applications will be treated with strictest confidence.
By submitting any application or resume to us, you will be deemed to have read and agreed to the terms of our Privacy Policy(https://stacs.io/privacy-policy/), and consented to us collecting, using, retaining and disclosing your personal information to prospective employers for their consideration.
You may refer and access our website(https://stacs.io/) for more information.

title: Data Analyst Intern (Contract-based)
company: MANITOWOC CRANE GROUP ASIA PTE. LTD.
company_info: About Manitowoc Manitowoc Cranes, a division of The Manitowoc Company, is recognized globally as one of the premierinnovators and manufacturers of crawler cranes, tower cranes, and mobile cranes for the heavy construction industry. Leading brands include Grove, Manitowoc, National Crane, and Potain. If you enjoy providing extraordinary technical support and solving customer issues, then you could be our next Field Service Technician at Manitowoc, Australia. If you’re up to the challenge, the reward is satisfaction. . . and knowing you helped build something real. Join our passionate team and help buildsomething you can be proud of – a future filled with passion, pride, and satisfaction.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Summary:

As a Data Analyst Intern, you will be responsible for starting our data analytics “team” in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large customer datasets in the APAC region.
You will assist Marketing, Sales and Aftersales +50 in generating insights and recommendations to drive data-driven decision-making and improve business processes. This internship provides a valuable opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analysis and contribute to meaningful projects within our organization.

Key Responsibilities:
Data Collection and Preparation:
Assist in gathering and organizing data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Clean and transform raw data into usable formats for analysis, employing data cleaning techniques and tools.
Data Analysis:
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and relationships within datasets.
Apply statistical methods and data visualization techniques to uncover insights and present findings effectively.
Report Generation and Presentation:
Assist in creating reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate analytical results to stakeholders.
Present findings and recommendations to the team, highlighting key insights derived from the data analysis.
Collaboration and Support:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support (ROA, INDIA, CHINA, ANZ, KR, JP).
Assist in developing data-driven solutions and strategies to address business challenges.
Research and Stay Updated:
Stay informed about industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analytics.
Conduct research on new data analysis tools and techniques, making recommendations for their adoption.
Qualifications and Requirements:
Currently pursuing a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with complex datasets.
Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis using tools such as Python, R, SQL, or Excel.
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib/seaborn.
Knowledge of statistical techniques and methodologies for data analysis.
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in data handling and analysis.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
Prior experience or coursework in data analysis or related fields is a plus.

title: Data Analyst, Hera Partner (1-year contract)
company_info: Eastspring Investments (Singapore) Limited Our company was first established in Singapore in 1994 and is a wholly-owned subsidiary of UK-based Prudential plc. Reinforcing an investment expertise and focus on Asia, the company formerly known as Prudential Asset Management (Singapore) Limited was re-named Eastspring Investments (Singapore) Limited on 14 February 2012. Today, Eastspring Investments (Singapore) Limited serves as the hub of the regional asset management business and manages a wide range of funds across various asset classes to service both retail and institutional clients. In Singapore, we are one of the largest fund management companies with approximately S$86.33 billion in funds under management, of which approximately S$61.72 billion are discretionary funds managed in Singapore (as at end March 2014), we offer a wide range of retail unit trusts to meet the diverse needs of our investors in Singapore.
address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 10 MARINA BOULEVARD 018983
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

A core team member of Data & AI, responsible for the collective success of the team and the company. The Data & AI team consist of various domain experts including Data Engineers, Data Developers and Data Analysts to perform multi-disciplinary, interrelated activities

Gather requirements:
Elicit data migration requirements from stakeholders, applying effective elicitation methods. Ensure requirements are complete
Document requirements and processes using industry-standard notations
Work with Finance SMEs and third-party vendors to define the scope of data extraction from various source systems
Work with Finance SMEs and system integration partner to define the scope of data requirements for the target applications
Perform data analysis to cleanse and standardize data, and ensure data consistency and quality
Work with Finance SMEs to transform the extracted data and prepare data migration templates for business sign-off
Work with system integration partner on error resolution and facilitate data reconciliation and sign-off from Finance SMEs post migration
Perform gaps and resolutions analysis
Assess and validate solutions:
Facilitate workshops with internal and external stakeholders to drive out solution options and works closely with them to complete solution design documents
Support functional and integration testing
Support change management and implementation:
Provide information as required to facilitate effective communications
Provide project support to the impacted teams during implementation phases, including answering queries, trouble shooting, liaison with service provider, and providing regular reporting
Contribute to project management processes, including status reporting, risk, issue, change, and compliance management
For smaller projects, act as the project manager as well as business analyst to deliver the project
------------------------------------------------

EXPERIENCE / QUALIFICATIONS

Must have at least 3 full lifecycle hands-on experience in preparing ADFdi, FBDI and HDL templates for migration into Oracle Cloud Financials
Working knowledge of Oracle Cloud Financial modules. Experience in working on Master and Transaction Data Migration from Legacy Applications into Oracle Cloud ERP (Financials)
Proficient with data wrangling, analytics, and transformation using tools such as Python, SQL, and Power Query
Experience in using business analyst methods such as flow charting, requirements capturing, stakeholder analysis, use cases, brainstorming, solution prototyping, and traceability
Experience in dealing directly with Finance end users and/or working on transformational projects that created substantial organizational level changes
Familiar with project management methodologies and frameworks
Familiar with Asian local markets and regulatory practices
CFA Level 1-3, or good understanding of asset management, is a plus

GENERAL CANDIDATE ATTRIBUTES
Inquisitive, analytical, and problem solver
Attentive to details and comfortable dealing with complex datasets, structured and unstructured
Customer-centric and strive to deliver value by effectively and proactively engaging stakeholders
Able to communicate complex ideas clearly and manage expectations with stakeholders. Has good negotiation skills
Able to prioritise and organise, take a flexible approach to workload, and work autonomously when required

company_info: SEACARE MANPOWER SERVICES PTE LTD Seacare Manpower Services Pte Ltd is a 100% subsidiary of Seacare Co-operative Ltd, jointly founded by the National Trade Union Congress (NTUC) and the Singapore Organization of Seamen (SOS). Established on 13th October 1995, it started off as a human resource agency for maritime and non-maritime personnel. title: Manager, Data Analyst, T&O Risk Governance and Assurance
company_info: Do you have what it takes to make a difference? Do you have what it takes to shape the future of Asia? We are seeking passionate, dynamic, self-motivated individuals who are driven towards performance excellence. As a leading bank in Asia-Pacific, we offer you challenges and opportunities to meet your career aspirations. At UOB, we are dedicated to making a big impression in the region. As a team, we know we will make a difference and shape Asia's future. Join us. Take up the challenge as we make our mark in Asia.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities
Apply statistical tools and models to derive key insights from risk related datasets and solve various business risk related problems.
Develop innovative solutions to improve and/ or automate key risk reporting. This includes building intuitive dashboards that help to visualize, analyze, monitor key risk/performance metrics to answer complex risk related problems.
Partner SMEs in identifying areas which require analytics support and include these use cases in development pipeline.
Liaise with stakeholders to customize and scale data analytic solutions across UOB subsidiaries.
Support the Head of Department in building and identifying enhancements to existing quality assurance and governance policies and processes.
Support special projects in response to internal and external (e.g. regulatory) request based on gaps identified for current analytics capabilities or models.
Job Requirements
Good university degree, preferably in computer science, engineering or analytical discipline, e.g. mathematics, statistics, IT, economics, finance, accounting. Master degree is preferred.
Proficiency across statistical toolsets (SQL, Python, R, SAS,), data visualization tools (Qliksense, Power BI) and Hadoop ecosystem. Knowledge in Python is an advantage.
Good to have - knowledge of a variety of predictive models, machine learning algorithms and statistical techniques, e.g. logistic regression, decision tree, clustering, neural networks, support vector machines, principal component analytics, natural language processing.
In-depth knowledge of banking or technology processes, banking products and the overall industry a strong plus.
1-3 years working experience in data analytics or business intelligence units, preferably in financial industry.
Excellent communication skills (verbal, written) to deliver insights to senior management and stakeholders.
Analytical mind with ability to translate the business problems and requirements into analytics solutions.
Capability to dive deep into data to find answers to yet unknown questions and have a natural desire to go beneath the surface of a problem.
Ask relevant questions and possess the skills to build algorithms necessary to find meaningful answers.
Self-motivated and driven, able to work independently and a good team player as part of a multidisciplinary team.

title: Senior Data & Reporting Analyst
company: FUJIFILM BUSINESS INNOVATION ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
company_info: FUJIFILM Business Innovation is committed to continue offering innovations to businesses globally to help maximize their organizational strengths. We have pioneered numerous technologies and accumulated expertise since our establishment as Fuji Xerox in Tokyo in 1962, to build an environment that encourages the use of one’s creativity by effectively adopting information and knowledge. Our portfolio includes conducting R&D, manufacturing and sales of world-class multifunction printers, production printers and IT solutions, as well as business process outsourcing services. On April 1, 2021, FUJIFILM Business Innovation changed its name from Fuji Xerox to a name that embodies its commitment to continue as a company that always pursues business innovation. FUJIFILM Business Innovation Asia Pacific is the regional headquarters of the global company, FUJIFILM Business Innovation Asia Pacific is the regional headquarters of the global company, FUJIFILM Business Innovation, providing corporate support and shared services for the Asia Pacific region.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
RESPONSIBILITIES & TASKS:
This role will involve conducting studies on current processes and work with multiple stakeholders to develop Global Standard and implementation based on Dynamics 365. Main responsibilities include:
Assist Business Transformation Manager to drive data management governance, business data standardization along with project requirement gathering & implementation phases
Partner with Business Users to address data quality challenges & make recommendation
Assist in driving master data requirement, mapping and standardization & alignment activities
Partner with business stakeholders to ensure Data Ownership and Stewards are identified
Participate in data cleansing activities with business stakeholders and the Information Management Team
Support the establishment of corporate data governance and control matrix to achieve data integrity
Support the transition and migration activities
Liaise with the relevant departments to ensure accurate key corporate KPI are gathered for Corporate Dashboard, establish Corporate Standard Reports or guide business activity
Collaborate closely with the Infrastructure Team on technical and system support
Proactively facilitate & gather and collate “as is” reporting requirements across various functions as part of D365 Implementation
Conduct review across various functions (Business Units, Supply Chain, Business Planning, Finance, Customer Service etc) to align common reporting requirements
Partner with Business Stakeholders to setup centralized standard regional corporate reports & control
Gather and establish Centralized Depository Business Data Definition and Central Library for WIP/SOP/Guides etc
Identify opportunities across various business lines to ensure the effectiveness Reporting needs
Work collaboratively to assist in the design and implementation of Data management & Reporting Tools with both internal (functional/ cross functional) and external stakeholders
Business partner with stakeholders with relevant and accurate information to challenge / support/ drive key decision making processes
Fulfil ad-hoc / Perform other related duties and assignment as required by adapting to competing demand, organizational changes and new responsibilities
REQUIREMENTS:
5 years or more experiences (Strategic & Business Analysis, Business Analytics)
Good Degree in Business Management / Engineering/ Science; Data Analytics Certification
Experience in data cleansing, data mapping, standardization & data migration activities
Good understanding of ERP modules as well as Business Intelligence & Analytical Tools (eg Tableau, IBM Cognos Analytics) will be an advantage
Developing requirements and must be able to transform an idea/ strategy into execution through project implementation

company_info: TBWA\Worldwide (www.tbwa.com) is a top-ten ranked global advertising collective that holds Disruption® at its core to develop business-changing ideas for brands. TBWA has 11,300 employees across 305 offices in 98 countries and also includes brands such as Auditoire, Digital Arts Network (DAN), eg+ worldwide, The Integer Group®, TBWA\Media Arts Lab and TBWA\WorldHealth. TBWA’s global clients include adidas, Airbnb, Apple, Gatorade, Henkel, McDonald’s, Michelin, Nissan, Pernod Ricard, Pfizer, Standard Chartered Bank, Singapore Airlines, Sotheby’s and Vichy.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About TBWA
TBWA is a highly-accoladed global, creative marketing agency, known for business-changing, culture changing and award-winning ideas for brands. It’s particularly famous for introducing the concept of Disruption to the market, something we continue to keep in our hearts. The volume, quality, and effectiveness of our creative output lead AdWeek to make us their 2018 Global Agency of the Year.
A little closer to home, and TBWA\Singapore works with many of the most prestigious clients in the
region – e.g. Standard Chartered Bank, Singapore Airlines, HP, Hilton and IKEA to name a few. TBWA\Singapore has also seen its fair share of awards this year receiving, amongst others the Creative Agency of the Year 2019 for Southeast Asia.
But, as everybody knows, you stand still, and you die.
So, TBWA continues to make significant investments to increase both the breadth and depth of capability within the agency - specifically within the data strategy team - expanding the department and placing it core to the agency offering.

What exactly does a Data Director do within Analytics & MarTech pillar?
As a Data Director – Analytics & MarTech, you will play a pivotal role within TBWA data function to lead and deliver on existing and new client’s requirements around digital data analytics.
You should be passionate about digital marketing analytics and data product development having an entrepreneurial mindset who would continually challenges the status quo and find disruptive ways of using data to meet client’s business objectives.
This is not a leisurely, back-seat, feet-on-the-table type of agency role, Quite the opposite which requires a very much hands-on experience with pro-active attitude towards the role.

What you will be doing as Data Director (Analytics & MarTech) ?
This is a techno-functional role that sits at the intersection of data, technology & strategy to drive consumer experience and marketing effectiveness more efficiently for clients. The ideal candidate will have a good understanding and hands-on experience of digital/martech platforms and data analytics to be able to:
Lead conversations with internal and external stakeholders on the strategic & innovative application of data analytics in solving clients’ business problems around consumer experience & marketing effectiveness.
Translate strategic brief into technical execution plan for the team of analysts, to ensure they get what they need to deliver on client deliverables, with an understanding of the overall clients strategic objectives.
Lead day-to-day operations and data projects for "Data Analytics & MarTech" pillar.
Create compelling client presentations and pitch decks that offer practical solutions to client's business problems leveraging data analytics & marketing technologies.
Present campaign performance data insights and observations into cohesive comms plans and recommendations to clients.
Build measurement frameworks and interactive visualizations and dashboards.
Configure and use digital platforms (web & social) to analyze online user behavior and provide meaningful insights and recommendations towards optimization.
Lead the development of innovative data products and solutions to solve clients’ business problems using best-in-class marketing technologies, processes, and frameworks.
Build digital analytics & reporting solutions with quality documentation such as architecture, data flow, process control & version control.
Stay abreast of matech landscape & application of AI within marketing and advertising domain.
Lead and coach data analysts within team to nurture their skills and guide them to progress & grow in their role.

What kind of experience we are looking for?
We are looking for someone who is confident within a data environment and comfortable with not-knowing everything but ALWAYS pushing to find out the answer
On a practical level, the ideal candidate will have:
8-10 years of experience in Performance Marketing / Digital Analytics role with evidence in strategic thinking and implementation of analytics solutions within an agency and/or client marketing environment.
Strong experience in driving strategic data projects using innovative application of AI & data analytics in solving client's business problem.
Experience in growing and managing high performing data team.
Strong data-story telling and presentation skills
Well versed MarTech landscape and various application of analytics and AI within marketing and advertising domain.
Strong experience in creating end-to-end analytics solution design and implementation strategies.
Strong experience with building enterprise-level dashboards in PowerBI and Tableau, or equivalent
Experience in building data analytics models and frameworks
Hands on experience on digital technologies such as Customer Data Platforms, Google360 (GA+GTM), Adobe Analytics & Launch (DTM), CRM Tools etc.
Strong understanding of multiple disciplines (e.g. CRM, analytics, loyalty, advertising, media) within marketing.

Vessel deployment optimization and service design/cargo flow optimization across Asia, Europe and Americas: Gather, organize and analyze information and data to determine the most efficient and cost-effective deployment of our vessel, considering factors such as cargo demand, route planning, fuel consumption and port selection.

Work closely with internal stakeholders to generate insights for decision making on fleet deployment and network optimization.

title: Senior / Analyst, Data Science, Office of Insights and Analytics
company_info: SINGAPORE HEALTH SERVICES PTE LTD
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
You will support the development and implementation of strategic plans for data management and analytics projects. You will collect and analyse data to identify trends and insights that will drive business decisions. You will need to have a strong background in data analytics and will be required to develop dashboards and other reporting tools to provide ongoing insight into key metrics that support the execution of key business strategies.
You will support the development and use of the data systems, perform data analysis, gap analysis, impact analysis to improve data quality, data governance, policy compliance and data standardisation. You will also monitor the data integrity within the analytics ecosystem for quality control, compliances and standardisation.
You will drive self-service analytics through data democratisation and collaboration with stakeholders across the organisation. You will drive the growth of data literacy across SingHealth and ensure that your solutions benefit users with varying proficiency in data literacy. You will identify and prioritise business needs, identify opportunities for cross-cluster data-driven innovation and improvement, and facilitate regular key management meetings.

Job Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Engineering, Business Analytics, Information System, System Engineering or related quantitative disciplines. Master Degree is an advantage.
Preferably 2 to 3 years of hands-on experience in data mining, data management, data modeling, data visualisation, business analytics and/or project management, with a focus on developing data-driven strategies. Candidates with more years of experience may be considered for the Senior Analyst position.
Knowledgeable in database structure systems and the DataOps methodology
Proficient in programming languages such as R and Python as well as business intelligence tools such as Tableau and OBIEE.
Experience in agile ways of working is an advantage.
Strong stakeholder engagement and presentation skills with a high degree of confidence to communicate with Senior Management.
Able to work collaboratively and cross-functionally with stakeholders from different business areas.
Strong problem-solving and quantitative computational ability
Meticulous and able to work effectively both independently and in a team
Prior experience in healthcare is an advantage.
Must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19

title: Lead Data Analyst II
company_info: FEDERAL EXPRESS (SINGAPORE) PTE LTD
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description

Relationships: APAC Business Intelligence, Analytics, Data Management and Data Science teams; APAC, international and global business functions
The Data Analyst SNR is a pivotal role in Service Quality Assurance organization supporting all AMEA functions and markets in the areas of Business Intelligence and Data Analytics. This is a challenging role that supports AMEA business functions with service visibility and tools to better understand failures/areas of opportunities. Your role will be to investigate key service problems, discover insights and recommend improvement actions through data mining and data visualization techniques. Next to that you will support other business functions and strategic projects with finding and understanding data, user training and coaching
Areas of responsibility:
1. Data analysis: Support key AMEA business processes with data analytics
Identify what data is needed, available and relevant to the problem
Design and develop strategic methods for data collection and analysis
Integrate and prepare datasets; build and evaluate data models
Explore and analyze data using statistical and visualization techniques
Define and describe common business metrics and KPI's
Summarize and present findings and recommendations to business users and stakeholders in understandable and relevant ways, both verbally and visually
Document and publish analyses so that others may reproduce and learn from prior work
2. Project support:
Support key AMEA Service initiatives with analytics solutions
Provide analytical and subject matter expertise for the development of analytics solutions needed to support main business strategies and initiatives
Work with peers in Business Intelligence, Data Management and Data Science to develop and provide solutions
Support the development of technical analytics solutions by communicating business requirements and providing subject matter expertise
Build plans; ensure work progress; identify and report success measures
Prepare and present progress reports and outcomes to stakeholders
3. Training and development: training solutions for analytical tools and techniques
Conduct or support training sessions and provide coaching to analysts in business functions and other key user groups in AMEA
To be successful in this role, you will need:
Education: A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Statistics, Business Analytics, Engineering or similar discipline
Experience: At least 4years practical/6years for Senior, data analytics experience in any industry
Applied analytical skills, including statistical knowledge; data modeling and visualization using modern BI/Analytics tools
Knowledge of exposure of Python, AI and ML is a plus to work on next gen service tools
Good communication skills, including the ability to tell compelling stories with data, verbally and visually
A good understanding of fundamental business principles and problems and the ability to constantly and independently ask questions, find answers, and learn
Professional skills: influencing& persuasion; judgement & decision making; leadership; planning & organizing. Project management certification is a plus.
SAFe Agile certification is a plus
Fluency in written and spoken English
