title: Master Data Analyst, APAC
company_info: ARTHREX SINGAPORE, PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Summary Requirements:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Main Objective:
The main objective of the Master Data Analyst, APAC is to facilitate the creation and maintenance of high quality master data related to all Arthrex materials and customers for the Asia Pacific Region. By implementing and executing policies and procedures at the regional level to ensure master data meets global standards. This role plays an important part in protecting a key Arthrex asset: the master data that enables the company to share information, process transactions, plan and execute business operations globally.

Master Data Analyst serves as a liaison to the global Product Life Cycle Management, Procure to Purchase (PTP) and Order To Cash (OTC) process owners. Through these relationships, Master Data Analyst receives the tools, policies, procedure, training and on-going guidance necessary to ensure that the practices he/she is following at the Regional level are aligned with Global Master Data practices.

Master Data Analyst key stakeholders whom he/she will work on a regular basis
INC MDG (Master Data Governance): responsible for creating and maintaining material master data for finished goods and creating new SKUs
Subsidiary Data Requestors: various parties within a subsidiary-specific organization responsible for providing the source data of the material and customer master data needed in each country, ie: country inventory planners may provide material master data for locally purchased products (Retail), and product extension requests that would be facilitated through Master Data Analyst, APAC
Subsidiary Data Stewards: Local Regulatory, Operations, Customer Service, Finance, Sourcing and Distribution professionals who provide and use specific master data
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Master Data Analyst main duties and responsibilities: Data Administration, Data Stewardship, Product Lifecyle Management Facilitation and Process Improvements.

Data Administration includes those tasks necessary to set up and maintain Material Master and Customer Master data in the SAP Systems. They are:
· Facilitate the creation of new material master data submitted by the subs data requestors
· Perform costing run for the material within the region / plant
· Maintain and/or enrich other related data eg: Purchase Information Records, Source Lists, etc
· Create and/or amend customer master data after performing quality checks
· Receive, analyze and implement requests for changes to material master and customer master data in cooperation with country data requestors and other country data stewards
· Respond to requests from data users to analyze and help resolve data problems that may be causing down stream transactional issues
· Maintain data cleanliness to ensure data integrity
· Maintain the service level agreement agreed with subs data requestors and other subs data stewards
Data Stewardship includes setting up and maintaining the regional procedures necessary for creating and maintaining high quality data. They are:
Maintain and support strong working relationship with Subsidiary data requestors and other country data stewards
Measure and report on regional data quality and adherence to the service level agreement
Review existing processes and make recommendations to improve efficiency and accuracy, which adhering to the company processes
Coordinate with various key stakeholders, ie: quality, finance, to effectuate required attributes within material master for a smooth end to end transaction within SAP
Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) facilitation involves collaborating with commercial and Product Managers/Marketing to ensure that product lifecycle strategies are implemented timely and accurately in the ERP system. They are:
Establishing appropriate master data settings to support the new product ramp-up or phase-out strategies
Assist to speed products to market by planning for and streamlining material master data setup for new product launches
Facilitate the collection of relevant data to compile specific PLM strategies
Assist with or lead special projects, but not limited to Process Improvements, including presentations materials and other duties as assigned.
Incidental Duties:
The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, and indeed additional responsibilities may be assigned, as required, by management.

Education and Experience:
· Bachelor's degree or equivalent experiences
· Minimum of 5 years Master Data experience or related experiences within Supply Chain

Knowledge and Skill Requirements/Specialized Courses and/or Training:
Excellent analytical abilities and attention to details
Knowledge of how the multiple SAP Master Data impact the business
Good written and oral English language communication skills.
Ability to work well within a group environment.

Machine, Tools, and/or Equipment Skills:
Intermediate to expert level Microsoft Excel
Good understanding of Microsoft Office Applications with a particular emphasis on mass data manipulation tools such as Excel (Pivot Tables, Macros and Vlookup)
Power BI and SAP R3 / HANA knowledge a MUST
Reasoning Ability:
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.

Mathematical Skills
Ability to comprehend and apply mathematical principles to the degree required to perform the job based upon job requirements.

Language and Communication Skills:
Ability to comprehend and apply language skills to the degree required to perform the job based upon the job requirements listed above. Ability to verbally communicate ideas and issues effectively to other team members and management. Ability to write and record data and information as required by procedures.

Physical Demands:
Good physical and mental health. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to be mobile within the office.

Vision Requirements:
Meets vision requirements to use personal computer and read documents.

Work Environment:
Regularly work at Singapore office. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Job Description:

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
We are seeking a skilled and motivated Data Engineer with expertise in SQL, Tibco, and Data Virtualization to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and optimizing data solutions using SQL, Tibco, and data virtualization technologies. If you have a passion for working with data, optimizing data pipelines, and ensuring data accessibility and reliability, this role offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to our data-driven initiatives.
Responsibilities:
Data Solution Design: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and design efficient and scalable data solutions using SQL, Tibco, and data virtualization technologies.
Database Development: Develop, implement, and maintain optimized SQL queries, procedures, and functions to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources into our databases.
Tibco Integration: Utilize Tibco integration tools to connect and integrate data from disparate sources, ensuring smooth and reliable data flow across systems.
Data Virtualization: Design and implement data virtualization solutions to provide a unified and simplified view of data from multiple sources, enhancing accessibility and reducing data duplication.
Performance Optimization: Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks in SQL queries, ETL processes, and data virtualization layers to ensure data pipelines run efficiently.
Data Quality and Governance: Implement data quality checks and validation processes to maintain high data accuracy and integrity. Adhere to data governance best practices and policies.
Collaboration: Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and other stakeholders to understand data usage patterns and provide data engineering support for analytical initiatives.
Documentation: Document data solution designs, ETL processes, and data integration workflows for knowledge sharing and reference.
Troubleshooting: Investigate and resolve data-related issues, ensuring data pipelines operate smoothly and addressing any data-related anomalies.
Stay Current: Keep up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in SQL, Tibco, and data virtualization technologies to recommend improvements and optimizations.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience as a Data Engineer or similar role, with a strong focus on SQL, Tibco, and data virtualization.
Proficiency in writing complex SQL queries, stored procedures, and database performance optimization.
Hands-on experience with Tibco integration tools or similar middleware platforms.
Familiarity with data virtualization concepts and tools, such as Denodo, Cisco Data Virtualization, or similar.
Strong understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL principles.
Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Shell) for automation and data manipulation is a plus.
Knowledge of data quality best practices and data governance principles.
Problem-solving skills and ability to diagnose and resolve data-related issues.
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Strong analytical thinking and the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Join our team and contribute to the development of cutting-edge data solutions using your expertise in SQL, Tibco, and data virtualization. Help us drive data-driven decision-making and enable seamless data integration across our organization.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
DEPT serves as a business function that covers Enterprise Data Governance, Data Management, Big Data Analytics and Enterprise Data Strategy. DEPT ensures that the BANK CLIENT meets all data governance standards set by data regulators and optimize data management and usage to help UOB make smarter, faster and more accurate decisions and to improve operational efficiency.

The Enterprise Data Management (EDM) team within the DEPT serves as:

a) The single point of contact for users across BANK for data issue escalations. The EDM team ensures that data hosted in data warehouse is of good quality and conforms to data standards such as completeness, accuracy and consistency, to support regulatory and management reports. The team also promotes data automation and makes use of data to help develop initiatives to improve productivity.
b) Data discovery through provision data requests to respective Data Playpen for business units across the Group. The objective advocates self-service data exploration and analysis within and among Business/Support Units. Data definition and specification documents are available to provide navigational guidance and support for data provision purposes.

Your main responsibilities include:
· Gathering and documenting business requirements & functional specifications on data related initiatives.
· Perform data profiling and gap analysis, source to target mappings, data issue capturing, resolution and escalation.
· Provide end-to-end project delivery support, including workshop planning, conducting of workshop walkthrough, user acceptance testing, defect support, continuous validation and assisting with rollout activities.
· Able to perform complex SQL scripting to meet user’s requests.
· Foster strong working & collaborative relationships with the business & technology stakeholders.
Requirements
· Minimum Bachelor Degree or equivalent professional qualifications in Computer Science with at least 2 years of working experience in banking industry, preferably with business / functional knowledge;
· Experience in gathering and documentation of business requirements;
· Knowledge in Data Warehousing, BI tools, Big Data platforms and experienced in the use of analytical /query tools. Must be able to query and understand database solutions.
· Experience in developing and documenting data-driven solutions – including capturing architectures, metadata systems, data dictionaries, databases and applications.
· Good team player who possesses drive and initiative;
· Excellent written / oral communication skills to effectively interact with different stakeholders and external vendors, able to work independently under pressure.

title: Data and System Analyst (Marketing & Financial)
company_info: CLEARSK HEALTHCARE PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Monthly Salary Range: $5,000 - 6,000

Join Our Team and Shape the Future of the Medical-Aesthetics Industry!

ClearSk Healthcare Group is an international aesthetics clinic chain headquartered in Singapore, with presence in Shanghai, Hangzhou and now Kuala Lumpur. We are a reputable provider of advanced aesthetic treatments and skincare solutions. Our dedication to excellence and personalized care has made us a leader in the medical aesthetic industry. As we continue to expand our services, we are seeking a skilled and adaptable Data and System Analyst to join our team. This role will play a crucial part in both marketing and financial aspects of our business, with a focus on customer accounts management. In your role you will have opportunities to work with doctors, para-medical and finance professionals.

Job Description
Job Summary: ClearSk Healthcare is looking for a versatile Data and System Analyst with expertise in both marketing and financial analysis. As a part of our team, you will be responsible for providing guidance and insights to our valued customers, ensuring they make informed financial decisions. Your analytical skills and data expertise will be instrumental in optimizing marketing campaigns, computing key performance indicators (KPIs), performing operational audits, and managing customer accounts effectively. Also, your willingness to be cross-trained in various related tasks including operate or track marketing campaigns or perform KPI computation or operational audit.

Responsibilities:
Analyze marketing data to track and optimize the performance of various marketing campaigns and initiatives.
Compute, track, and report key performance indicators (KPIs) for marketing and financial performance evaluation.
Conduct operational audits to identify areas for improvement in marketing strategies and financial processes.
Manage and analyze financial data, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and data integrity.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop financial models, forecasts, and performance metrics for customer accounts management.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to clients based on data analysis, helping them achieve their financial objectives.
Utilize data analysis tools and techniques to identify trends, anomalies, and risks in customer accounts.
Assist clients in understanding financial reports and interpreting data to aid their decision-making process.
Develop and implement data-driven strategies to optimize financial performance and business outcomes.
Liaise with internal stakeholders to ensure seamless account management and address customer inquiries effectively.
Qualifications and Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics, Data Science, Business Analytics, Finance, or related fields. Applications from recent graduates are highly encouraged.
Proficient in data manipulation using spreadsheets such as Google Sheets or Excel
Skilled in data processing and computational work
Quick learner with a keen interest in acquiring and applying trending IT skills
Familiarity with tools like chatGPT, Zapier, and Shopify, which require no coding or IT experience
Ability to adapt and be cross-trained in operating or tracking marketing campaigns, performing KPI computation, and conducting operational audits.
Willingness to learn and adapt under the guidance of experienced managers
Attention to detail and accuracy in financial analysis and reporting.
Strong organizational and time management skills to handle multiple priorities effectively.
Application process:
Should you wish to be considered for shortlisting, please complete the attached Google Form at the link below prior to submitting your application on the platform:
https://forms.gle/hRJVt819mXFCyWXp8
Please be advised that only candidates who have completed the form and are subsequently shortlisted will be notified.

title: HR Payroll and Data Analyst
company_info: WHO ARE WE? Gates Corporation is the world’s leading manufacturer of power transmission belts and a premier global manufacturer of fluid power products. Our highly engineered products are critical components used in diverse industrial and automotive applications where the cost of failure is very high relative to the cost of our products. We sell our products globally under the Gates brand, which is recognized by distributors, original equipment manufacturers, and installers as the premium brand for quality and technological innovation, a reputation which we have built for over a century since our founding in 1911. Our products and services serve customers in the following end market segments: Energy, Exploration & Extraction (Oil & Gas) Infrastructure & Agriculture (Mobile Equipment) Transportation (Fleet & Heavy-Duty) Automotive (Passenger Cars & Light Trucks) Process & Specialty (Manufacturing) As an engineering leader with a strong foundation in research and development, Gates is committed to advancing the science of motion performance by developing safe, forward-thinking products, services, systems, and solutions, as well as fostering long-term customer and employee relationships. Headquartered in Denver, Colorado, Gates employs over 14,000 people across 106 locations in 30 countries. Help us dream, create, innovate, build, and broaden possibilities. Never has our work been so critical to progress, change, and a thriving economy. You can be a part of the story. And we can help you find what moves you. http://www.gates.com/about-gates http://www.gates.com/about-gates/careers
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Driven by Possibility
Gates Corporation is a leading manufacturer of application-specific fluid power and power transmission solutions. At Gates, we are driven to push the boundaries of materials science to engineer products that continually exceed expectations.
We don’t rest on our rich heritage of innovation. We leverage it to inspire solutions that will power the next hundred years. We invest continually in R&D and technology, so our products not only outperform industry standards; they exceed our customers’ demanding expectations. We invest in our people, bringing real-world experience that enables us to solve our customers’ diverse challenges of today and anticipate those of tomorrow. And we are constantly expanding our product catalog and value-added service offerings to support every facet of our customers’ operations. In the most extreme environments and those more familiar, Gates is there with the right product, in the right place at the right time. Whether building original equipment or maintaining products in the aftermarket, we enable companies in every industry to be more efficient, productive, and profitable. We are Gates.

POSITION SUMMARY
We are searching for a HR Payroll and Data Analyst who possesses the HRIS/payroll and data analytics skills and is passionate about creating a structured human resource information system and data analytic tool to operate effectively in a matrix environment and have confidence in supporting aggressive growth plans. The person should have a consultative and collaborative style, proven track record / achievement. We are only shortlisting driven, resilient, enterprising, agile and motivated individual who wants to be part of a growing company.

THE ROLE
This role is responsible for executing regional HRstrategies and actions plans to ensure accurate and timely HRIS/payroll data and providing HR data analysis supportto regional HR leader to achieve overall organization’s objectives. In addition this role would have to liaise with Multi-discipline team including support functions, to delight our Internal stakeholders.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES / ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Other duties may be assigned beyond the core functions listed below.
The responsibilities of the role are to implement the required action plan, manage data consolidation, analysis and reporting activities to support efforts to achieve optimal human capital productivity and value add. The role shall carry out tactical activities to streamline data inputs and process, ensure data accuracy and timely data outputs to respective Regional leaders and Departments, manage monthly payrolls verification process and employee end to end employment activities. In addition, it is to support key tasks, including support Talent Acquisition, Talent Management and Total Rewards activitiesaligned with Regional vision and aspirations.
The HR Payroll & Data Analyst’s specific responsibilities will fall into three primary areas:

Maximum 3 pointers per accountability
Accountability #1: Customer (Internal / External Stakeholders)
Management of outsource payroll vendors for South East Asia
Ensure approval process of payroll in accordance with SOX requirements
Consolidation, analysis and reporting of regional HR dashboard and indicators to regional HR Director and other stakeholders
Accountability #2: Process / Performance
Be the subject matter expert for HRIS Oracle system, compliance to Service Level Agreements and HFM cost centers mapping to HR system & reports
Ensure and arrange onboarding & job induction program for new hires.
Execute the day to day HR operational administration matters for eg. but not limited to monthly payroll processing, arrange onboarding & job induction program for new hires, conduct exit interviews and exit clearance and consolidate data to TA for analysis, maintenance of structured Personnel File management for traceability
Assist in the development and implementation of Human Resources policies and procedures and their dissemination through employee booklets, communications, and/or meetings

Accountability #3: People
Educate other local HR personnels in East Asia and India on HRIS and HFM cost centres mapping
KEYS TO SUCCESS:
Lead with an outside in mindset to place customers in the center of everything we do.
Exemplify Gates ethics and core values to develop talents with right skills, knowledge and behavior,
Advocate reward for performance to drive accountability for sustainable growth
Design a contemporary and innovative learning environment to attract diverse talent pool.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: The incumbent reports HR Business Partner ASEAN & operate in individual contributor capacity.

YOUR QUALIFICATIONS/ QUALIFICATIONS & PREFERRED SKILLS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
This person must have at least 3 years hands on experience in working with HRIS system and have good understanding of local government labor regulations / employment law / social security regulations in the assigned countries or region.
Diploma in Business, Human Resource, Finance, Data Science, Statistics or related fields
Minimum 2 years, proven track record in in managing outsourced payroll processes in Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia and Vietnam

REQUIRED SKILLS:
Detail-oriented with well-developed administrative and organisation skills
Familiar with data visualization tools and data-driven applications (i.e. PowerBI, Cognos)
Deep expertise in MS Excel in writing advanced formulas and charts development
Strong analytical skills with the ability to handle multiple sources and large amount of data, make hypotheses and analytical recommendations and provide business insights to the management
Enthusiastic and strong learning ability to research new HR analytics and trends
Excellent team player with good communication skills
PHYSICAL DEMANDS: (travel, etc)
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, and reach with hands and arms. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision.
We are firmly committed to the equitable treatment of all our employees and qualified applicants for employment. Equal opportunity in all aspects of employment is one of our firmest and most basic beliefs and we will not tolerate any illegal discrimination, harassment or retaliation. The Company will not tolerate discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, religion, national origin, sex, age, physical or mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation or any other protected class.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our Client a supply chain operator is in the midst of expanding their IT Team. This is a great opportunity to join a growing data science team IT. You will be a part of a diverse and global team that is leading the way in developing cargo solutions that make supply chains more agile, resilient, and sustainable.

Role
Data Extraction and Analysis: extract and analyse large volumes of data from various sources. He or she will gather relevant data for audit testing, identifying patterns, anomalies, and trends, and performing data-driven analysis to assess control effectiveness, detect fraud, or identify areas of risk.
Data Visualisation: create visually appealing and insightful dashboards, charts, and graphs to present audit findings and communicate complex data in a more understandable and impactful manner.
Data Analytics Tools and Techniques: use data analytics tools and techniques such as statistical analysis, regression modelling, data mining, and predictive analytics to assist internal auditors in identifying key risk indicators, conducting trend analysis, and predicting potential risks or control weaknesses.
Automation and Continuous Monitoring: automate repetitive audit tasks, such as data extraction, data cleansing, and report generation, by leveraging data analytics software or programming languages. This is to allow auditors to focus more on higher-value activities and perform continuous monitoring of key controls and indicators.
Fraud Detection and Prevention: to assist internal auditors in developing and implementing data-driven fraud detection and prevention techniques. He /she will analyze transactional data, identify suspicious patterns or outliers, and collaborate with auditors to design and implement controls that mitigate fraud risks effectively. Investigations assignments may also be conducted when required or on requests of management.
Data Governance and Data Quality: contribute to the establishment of robust data governance frameworks and data quality assurance processes and work closely with IT teams to ensure data integrity, accuracy, and availability, which is crucial for reliable audit testing and analysis.

Requirements

Education
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Management, Engineering, or a related field.
Skillsets and Experience
At least 4years of relevant working experience in data analytics, process improvement, and digital transformation.
Experience using data analytics tools and techniques to extract, analyze, and visualize large volumes of data.
Experience using robotics and intelligence tools to automate repetitive tasks and improve work processes.
Experience using business intelligence tools to create dashboards and reports that communicate data insights.
Knowledge of software (Galvanize Highbond) and analytics tools (ACL, Oracle Transaction Business Intelligence OTBI) is an advantage.
Prior experience working in Internal audit deparment would be an advantage.

title: Environment, Social & Governance Data Analyst
company: LASALLE INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT ASIA PTE LTD
company_info: LASALLE INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT ASIA PTE LTD LaSalle Investment Management is one of the world’s leading real estate investment managers. With presence in 15 countries worldwide, we manage approximately $65 billion (as of 2Q 2020) of private and public property equity investments. Our diverse client base includes public and private pension funds, insurance companies, governments, endowments and private individuals from across the globe. Unlike many investment management firms, we invest only in real estate and therefore have a unique focus and depth of expertise in the sector. Our primary objective is to deliver competitive performance while striving to achieve the highest levels of client service.
job_category: Banking and Finance, Real Estate / Property Management
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
ESG DATA ANALYST (SINGAPORE)
JOB PROFILE

LaSalle Investment Management (“LaSalle”) is a global real estate investment manager with more than $82 billion of private and public real estate assets under management and over 900 employees in 15 countries worldwide. Our diverse investor base includes public and private pension funds, insurance companies, governments, endowments, and high net worth investors from across the globe. LaSalle sponsors private separate accounts, private open and closed-end commingled funds, and public real estate securities programs. As a wholly owned member of the Jones Lang LaSalle group, LaSalle's investment teams also draw on the intelligence and resources of our parent company, giving us unique access to market opportunities and key industry leaders. LaSalle has the ambition, creativity, and opportunity to be a global leader in technology-driven real estate investment management, and the successful candidate will have a key role in driving this transformation.

LaSalle offers specialized real estate services to meet changing client expectations and market conditions. With an established presence in, and an intimate knowledge of, local real estate and capital markets worldwide, LaSalle creates value for clients by addressing their local, regional, and global needs as well as their broader business, strategic, operating, and financial goals. LaSalle has innovative thought leadership and prides itself in a ‘client-first’ mentality, striving for exceptional client satisfaction through the highest level of services.

Reporting
Based in Singapore, this role reports to Jian Gong, Senior Vice President, Sustainability, based in Tokyo

Responsibilities

ESG Data Management: Collection, Entry & Validation:
· Collect and collate ESG data from various sources, including underlying property-level documents and regular meetings with relevant teams.
· Enter and maintain accurate ESG data in designated databases, spreadsheets, and internal systems, with quality
checks to ensure data integrity and consistency.
· Collaborate with internal stakeholders to resolve data discrepancies and address data-related inquiries on a monthly basis.
· With the support of the ESG Manager, assist to train property managers of newly acquired properties on how to prepare operational data using our data templates.
· Support the development, implementation and maintenance of data management protocols and best practices.
· Assist in the integration and automation of ESG data processes, where applicable.

Data Analysis and Reporting Support:
· Assist in analyzing ESG data to identify trends, patterns, and key performance indicators.
· Support the preparation of ESG reports and disclosures, ensuring accurate and timely data inputs.

Stakeholder Engagement and Collaboration:
Together with the ESG Manager:
· Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including sustainability teams, asset managers, and finance departments, to gather relevant ESG data inputs.
· Be the primary point of contact for sustainability data and support LaSalle’s Real Innovation program.
· Co-ordinate sustainability programs, including arranging contract signing and invoicing.
· Support the collection and checking of data for the annual GRESB submissions.
· Other ESG related duties as assigned

Required Qualifications & Experience:
· 1 to 2 years of data management experience.
· Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics etc.
· Ability to manage complex documentation, fully proficient in all Microsoft Office applications.

title: Group Data Engineer
company_info: Since our formation in 2005, TES has been a global leader in providing IT Lifecycle Services, offering bespoke solutions that help customers manage the commissioning, deployment and retirement of Information Technology (IT) assets. We understand the common challenges faced when managing IT equipment throughout its lifecycle, providing cost effective solutions whilst achieving compliance with all local and international data security, environmental, and industry regulations. A new facility for recycling lithium-ion batteries found in mobile phones and electrical vehicles is opened in Mar 2021. It will recycle 14 tonnes of lithium-ion batteries or equivalent of 280,000 smartphones batteries each day.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Data engineers build and maintain data systems. They construct datasets that are easy to analyse and support company requirements through developing and maintaining infrastructures for data generation.
Data engineers implement methods to improve data reliability and quality. They are responsible for expanding and optimizing data and data pipeline architecture while optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The data engineers will work closely with software developers and support data analysts on data initiatives and ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
Datalake Management
Construct, test and maintain AWS-based data pipeline architectures.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS ‘big data’ technologies.
Optimize data ingestion pipelines from data sources to the data lake and data lake to ongoing projects.
Ensure up-to-date ingestion and streaming of raw data from disparate data sources into a central data lake.
Keeping the data in the data lake functional relative to business requirements and software developer updates.
Data Provision
Work with stakeholders including the Data Analytics and other business units in ongoing projects to address technical issues and supplement data infrastructure needs.
Create data tools for data analytics and scientist teams that assists in building and optimizing our products efficiently.
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in data systems.
Job Requirements:
Bachelor degree in following specializations:
Business Analytics
Data Analytics
Information Systems
Computer Science
Mathematics
Statistics
Any other quantitative fields
Experience and Qualities:
Experience in working SQL knowledge.
Experience in working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) and database management systems.
Experience or exposure to Amazon Web Services and its suite of ‘big data’ technologies.
Exposure to data lake and central repositories.
Exposure to data modelling and machine learning techniques.
Proficient in Python/Java programming language.
Adept in handling large and unstructured datasets.
Possesses an analytical mind and hunger for problem-solving.
Meticulous in handling data and attention to detail in analysis.
Creativity in reinventing and optimizing data pipeline processes.
Strong command in communication skills on both verbal and written spectrums.
Enthusiastic, initiative and motivated in personal development through passive experience and active participation in learning and education opportunities.

title: Regional Customer Engagement Analyst
company_info: Menarini is the world’s largest Italian biopharmaceutical company with a heritage of over 128 years, and more than 16,000 employees in over 100 countries. Here in Asia-Pacific, Menarini’s vision is to be a leading provider of important healthcare brands to improve the lives of people in the region. Menarini Asia-Pacific operates across the entire commercial value chain, from regulatory approval and product launch to lifecycle management with a diverse portfolio of proprietary and partnered brands in key therapeutic fields, including Dermatology, Select Specialty Care, Allergy/Respiratory, Cardiovascular, Men’s Health and Consumer Health.
address: MAPLETREE BUSINESS CITY, 30 PASIR PANJANG ROAD 117440
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
POSITION SUMMARY:
The role of Regional Customer Engagement Analyst is to create and maintain a suite of regular reports to update stakeholders on customer engagement metrics and identify insights and opportunities for generating business growth across Asia Pacific. You will report to the Regional Head of Customer Engagement, Digital Marketing & Innovation and you will work closely with the Senior Data & Analytics Lead to optimize Menarini Customer Engagement ecosystem and Business Inteligence (BI) solutions in APAC by performing data extraction, mapping, formatting, cleansing and visualization. You will work with country, regional and global stakeholders to establish and streamline processes related to data quality and visualization. You will manage and optimize a number of different data analytics sources from marketing automation, e-commerce, CRM, segmentation, portals, webinars to derive insights for business decision making, omnichannel operations and help define the future of customer experience as a business strategy by painting an accurate, forward-looking view of how it will evolve with AI models.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manage and maintain the standardized customer engagement data pipelines, dashboards and reports with digital scorecards suggesting recommendation for business performance improvement
Develop data visualizations to generate informed business decisions
Assist in conducting business process analysis and needs assessments in an effort to align IT/data infrastucture and intelligence solutions with business initiatives
Conduct Root Cause Analysis (RCA) and proactively identify operational improvement opportunities that deliver customer satisfaction, cost optimization and revenue growth
Work with other business teams to monitor the impact of our activities to improve customer engagement and experience
Ensure quality data mining from tracking mechanism (e.g. event and conversion tracking) on the website and other digital assets
Test, measure, analyze, and optimize the performance of search, social, content to display across conversion funnels to boost customer engagement and conversions, lower cost of customer acquisition, and increase customer life-time value (LTV)
Support regional stakeholders in developing customized digital data reports from existing data model to support and provide actionable insights in the ever changing needs in the digital space
Participate the UAT of Corporate Digital Marketing applications, support documentation and coordinating to deploy them to the markets in Asia Pacific
Identify data quality issues and assisting to develop suitable remediation actions
Utilize analytics tools to support the extraction, analysis, cleansing and transformation
Collaborate with stakeholders across multiple departments and countries to translate data into business insights
Identify continuous improvements & enhancement to improve data visualization
KEY REQUIREMENTS:
University degree (business, marketing, data, finance or computing related)
Minimum 2 years as a Business/Marketing/Data Analyst, who is able to communicate with both technical and business teams
Prior experiences with omnichannel digital customer journey mapping and BI solutions, knowledge in data query/wrangling using SQL, and data visualisation using tools like Tableau/Power BI, Google Analytics and other languages e.g., Python/R/Scala are helpful
Hands on experiences with Customer Engagement Marketing Tools, GTM, Google Analytics, Social Media Analytics, Search console, E-commerce sales data, Oracle BI Answer, Data Visualization, Publisher
Knowledge of Oracle Database and Big Query
Hands on experiences on data quality improvement and data cleansing
Able to handle a volume of documentations, training materials etc.
A digital and innovative mindset combined with an agile way of working
Understand the range of metrics used to measure value and effectiveness
Comfortable in analyzing data in a variety of formats and granularity, able to analyse and present data to demonstrate the effectiveness of key marketing activities
Able to manage multiple projects/tasks simultaneously, detailed, accurate and delivers projects on time
Highly analytical and proficient in spreadsheets
Highly motivated individual, team player
Excellent communication skills to “make data speak”
Interpersonal skills and ability to work with different cultures/personalities essential
